She is asking for this, her second loan, to buy construction materials to build a room and have more space. Her goal is to increase her sales volume and make more money, a goal which thanks to Afodenic is becoming reality.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame K. abla est mariée à un monsieur qui est soudeur, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’avédji, elle à 6 enfants,  elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de denrées alimentaires, c’est cette activité qui lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.  Le crédit qu’elle demande à WAGES va lui permettre d’agrandir son stock avec 4paniers de tomates, 4 paniers de poissons, 10 bidons d’huile de palme, 6 paniers de Gombo.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Abla is married to a gentleman who is a welder. She lives with her family in the Avédji district and has six children. Her income-generating work involves selling foodstuff. It’s a business that enables her to assist her husband with household expenses. The loan from WAGES that she’s asking for will allow her to increase her inventory of goods with: four baskets of tomatoes, four baskets of fish, ten drums of palm oil, and six baskets of okra.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Loluama

texts.en: Loluama L., 55, is married with six children. She has three years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the villagers seven days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~62 USD). SPBD loans are Loluama’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy raw materials needed to upgrade her business.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, yeast, oil, kerosene cooker and frying pan

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen L. has a small piggery. She is 41 years old, married and has three children. She dreams of having a store someday. For now, she is happy to have all her pigs for her business. Her husband, Welfredo L., is a farmer. Her husband manages their small rice field to supplement their income. 

As a mother, Helen wants to help especially in the family finances. She wants to avail loans from CEVI to support her pig business. The purpose of her loan is to buy feed and piglets. The loan will truly help her increase the size of her business.

Helen L. has been a CEVI client for a long time already. She enjoys having easy access to CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth lucha sola por el bienestar de sus tres hijos, quienes son su mayor orgullo, pues son muy responsables y dedicados en sus estudios; por ello, trata de darles las comodidades posibles para que sigan desarrollándose como hombres de éxito. Desde que se separó de su pareja fue asumiendo nuevos retos como madre y como comerciante, pues se esfuerza por el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual inició hace 8 años junto a su pareja, pero hoy trata de atender a sus clientes con la ayuda de sus hijos. Elizabeth vende cerveza para diversos eventos sociales, grandes y pequeños. Pero más adelante, desea abrir una tienda de bebidas en su casa para dejar de trasladarse de un lugar a otro y dejar de pagar los altos costo de alquiler del local donde almacena su producto, pero mientras junta el capital necesario seguirá trabajando igual, hasta que sus hijos cumplan sus metas como estudiantes y puedan ser un apoyo para ella dentro de su hogar. Desde hace 5 años pertenece a su banco comunal, este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, lo que le gusta de su grupo es la interrelación personal que hay entre sus compañeras, además del trabajo que realizan con el fin de tener mayores ingresos y progresar. Los 3500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más cerveza para cubrir sus pedidos este mes, pues hay muchos eventos festivos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth struggles alone for the well being of her three children, who are her greatest pride since they are very responsible and dedicated to their studies; therefore, she tries to give them all the comforts possible so that they continue to develop into successful men. Since she separated from her spouse she has been assuming new responsibilities as a mother and a business woman, as she tries to grow her business that she started 8 years ago with her husband, and now is is trying to service her customers with the help of her sons Elizabeth sells beer at various social events, large and small. In the future she plans to open a beverage store in her home so that she can stop having to move from one place to another and stop paying the high rent for the storage of her products. In the meantime, until she has the finances necessary, she will continue as she is doing now until her sons reach their educational goals and can be of support for her in her home. She has belonged to her community bank for the last 5 years, this is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She likes the personal interaction with her partners in the group, in addition to the work they accomplish toward the goals of improving their incomes and getting ahead. The 3500 soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beer to cover her orders for the month, there are a lot of festive events in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren D. lives with his wife and two teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two sons are high school students.

Davaasuren has a small carpentry business. He makes furniture and other wooden household items. He started his business in 2006 with 50,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,450 MNT). From the beginning, his business has done quite well and his capital has increased to 2,000,000 MNT. He mostly sells his handmade furniture to herder families in the countryside. Sometimes he barters his furniture in exchange for sheep and goats. He usually obtains requests for new furniture from families in the town because of the high quality and design of his products.

In the future, he would like to focus on the quality of his products, which Davaasuren values very much. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: Purchase woods to build furniture.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Diouldé, 22 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour louer une boutique et l’approvisionner en marchandise. L’activité est menée avec l’appui de son mari. Elle veut contribuer à l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Diouldé, age 22, is married and has three children in her care. She is requesting a loan to lease a shop and to supply it with merchandise. This business is managed with her husband’s support. She wants to help with maintaining her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease and to supply a shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Seventeen people living in Khsom village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chantha P. is the 34-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy rice seed. She plans to use the rest of money to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Prach Sarith, is a construction worker. This couple has three children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
31-year-old Tabu is a member of the Maendeleo borrowing group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a single mother of 2 children, aged 10 and 14 years. She also cares for 2 other dependents. Tabu started her own salon 1 year ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian Shillings.

This is Tabu’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more equipment for her salon. With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Tabu hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her salon

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie N. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 38 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie sells seafood like fish and shrimp in the local community. Margie has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Margie joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase more seafood, and she is now requesting her 5th PMPC loan of 11,000 PHP.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase seafood for her market stall.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
EL Sr. Julio tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado hace varios años con la Sra. Eustaquia de profesión masajista, tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores y independientes.
El Sr. Julio es propietario de un taller de costura hace más de 6 años, tiene 4 empleados a su cargo y realiza trabajos de cortinados, tapicería y todo articulo de ropería para empresas en forma tercerizada y también a clientes exclusivos.
Se inicio con una pequeña maquina de coser junto con una ex compañera de trabajo iniciaron una pequeña sociedad. Actualmente cuenta con 7 máquinas industriales para confección de todo tipo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas de temporada.
texts.en:
Julio is 58 years old and married for various years to Eustaquia who is a professional masseuse. They have 3 children, all adults living independently.

For 6 years, Julio has been the proprietor of a sewing shop. He has 4 employees under his charge making curtains, tapestry, and all articles of clothing for enterprises that outsource the work, as well as for exclusive clients.

He began with a small sewing machine. Then, he and a former work companion formed a small partnership. Presently, they have 7 industrial machines that can be used in manufacturing of all types. Julio is asking for a loan to buy cloth that is in season.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH FOR FALL AND WINTER

loans.name: Lovina

texts.en:
Lovina is 35 years old and married with seven children. She sells drinks and cooked food. She is from Okada in Edo State.

Lovina is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar M. G. quiere darle a su esposa una mayor comodidad al momento de cocinar por que donde viven es una casa de interés social y son muy pequeñas por lo que la cocina esta muy estrecha solo es un pasillo pequeño donde la señora apenas cabe. El señor viendo la necesidad y darle gusto a su esposa recurre a nosotros; para que lo apoyemos en su proyecto. Para ampliar su cocina el necesita comprar material para construcción y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Omar M. G. wants to give his wife greater convenience when cooking because they live in public housing and their home is very small. The kitchen is very narrow; it is only a small hallway where his wife can barely fit. Omar, seeing the need and wanting to please his wife, has turned to "Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP)" (Foundation for Progressive Housing) for support in this project. To expand his kitchen, Omar needs to buy construction materials and to pay for manual labor.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand kitchen

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou est une femme de 58 ans, elle est veuve et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2 depuis 3 ans et tous les prêts qu'elle a reçu ont été toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle commercialise du tissu et de l'encens. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle assure la nourriture de ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 58-year-old woman and a widow with four children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years. All the loans she received were always repaid without a problem. With her current, loan she is marketing fabrics and incense. With the profits she makes, she ensures that her four children are fed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her micro-enterprise

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza-21 Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Nueva Esperanza 21” esta representada por la señora Rosa Victoria y conformado por trece miembros que en su mayoría radican en la zona 21 D. diciembre  las socias son dedicadas a la comercialización  y venta D. diferentes productos como venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrios, a la elaboración y comercialización D. muebles D. madera en talleres D. carpintería, venta D. coca, venta D. comida, carne D. cerdo,  cosméticos, tiendas D. barrio y  taller D. mecánica.                                                                                                                 Los socios están en un mercado altamente competitivo ellas tienen sus estrategias D. como asegurar la venta D. sus producto además ya son conocidas en el mercado local y pretenden llegar a mercados internacionales mejorando la calidad D. sus productos.                                                                                                            El destino del crédito es para realizar compras D. insumos para sus tiendas y algunos para la compra D. equipos y herramientas para sus talleres otras D. las socias requieren del capital para la adquisición D. mercadería para agrandar mas sus tiendas.
Este grupo esta emprendiendo su sexto ciclo, la mayoría D. ellos ya se conocen entre si y cuentan con experiencia puesto que participaron durante cinco ciclos, es un grupo D. personas responsables, unidas y sobre todo con muchas granas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria represents the Nueva Esperanza 21 group. It is comprised of 13 members; most of them are from the 21 D. Diciembre region. The members sell different products. Some have neighborhood grocery stores. Some make and sell wood furniture in carpentry shops. Some sell coca, food, pork, and cosmetics. Some have neighborhood stores, and some have mechanic shops. The members are in a market that is highly competitive. They have their strategies for assuring the sale of their products. Also, they are well known in the local market, and they intend to arrive on the international market by improving the quality of their products. The loan is to buy supplies for their stores. Some will use it to buy equipment and tools for their shops. Others need the loan to buy merchandise to expand their stores. This group is undertaking their sixth cycle. Most of them know each other already and have experience, given that they have participated in five cycles. It is a group of united and responsible people. Above all, they have a great desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has four children, between the ages of 10 and 22. He sells clothes and shoes in Gikomba Market and has one employee. He has been in business for fifteen years and has successfully completed two previous loans with Faulu. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more inventory. 

In the future, John would like to expand his business and become a more prominent businessman. He describes himself as hardworking and says that he has learned how to keep records and provide customer care in Faulu, where he is his group's treasurer.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying jewelry for resale

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia Maribel S. V. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 12 años de edad, del los cuales el mayor trabaja y estudia, mientras que los menores estudian y le ayudan a su madre a atender el negocio. Sonia posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, los cuales los comercializa desde hace 9 años. Sonia es una mujer la cual se esfuerza mucho por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijo, no solo en lo económico sino también se ha encargado de concientizar a sus hijos y guiarlos por el buen camino. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Maribel S. V. lives in the department of Ahuachapán, she lives with her three children of 17, 16 and 12 years of age. Of the three children, the oldest works and goes to school and the younger two go to school and help their mom with the business. Sonia has a store of perishable and daily use items, she has had this market for nine years. Sonia is a strong woman who does her best to support her children, not only economically but also she advises her children and guides them along a good road. Sonia is seeking a loan so that she can resupply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishible items

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah C. M., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Luis M. and they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been making slippers and bags and selling them to her customers for three years.

Jonah has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used almost all the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for her sandals and slipper making.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 7,000 per month.

Now with your help, Jonah would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying leather, sewing materials and other fabrics for her footwear business.

Jonah dreams that her products will become well-known someday and prays that they will have enough money so that they can help those who are in need.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for her footwear and bag-making business

loans.name: Juana Epifanía

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene venta de comida las cuales realiza los fines de semana el crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo en el mismo y así poder darle una mejor atención a sus clientes, estos créditos con CEPRODEL del cual ha trabajado un año le han beneficiado a mejorar su calidad de vida y los ingresos para su familia, el negocio lo tiene desde hace mas de diez años y empezó con ahorros propios, ella vive con su esposo donde los dos trabajan hombro a hombro.
texts.en:
Señora Juana sells food on the weekends. She will use this loan to invest in this business so she can give her customers better service. She has worked with Ceprodel for one year, and these loans have benefited her and have let her improve her quality of life as well as her family's income. She has had this business for more than 10 years. She started it with her own savings. She lives with her husband, and they both work side by side.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juice, chicken, meat, ketchup, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is friendly and a hard-working woman. She sells electrical materials to make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells for long hours to make her business sustainable. She hopes to expand her business in the future by adding the sale of electronics. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purcchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom T. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and is specialized in growing rice. She typically generates an income of $3 per day. She has always received help from her husband in planting crops. This couple has been married for years and has six children. They all are students and are also temporary laborers. After the rainy season for rice passed and the rice drying season arrived, Thom T. lacked some supplies to use in growing her crops. So, she has asked for a loan of $500 to be used to plow the farmland. She will then buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 27 year old married lady. She is a mother of one child who is in school.   Her husband works for a transport company.    She has been buying clothes and re-selling them to earn some profit for five years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business profits have increased.  She plans to expand her business to a wholesale in the future.  She has requested a loan of kes 90,000 to add stock of clothes. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Teotima

texts.en:
Teotima A. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Teotima is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Teotima owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Teotima has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Teotima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teotima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teotima chose to request a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Teotima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise & sell

loans.name: Julio Armando

texts.es:
El señor Julio Armando O. O. es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Tesorero, es casado y tiene tres hijos pero solo uno a su cargo y estudia en la Universidad, lleva ya cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL  y le ha ayudado enormemente en la preparación de carrera de sus hijos pues dos de ellos ya culminaron sus estudios Universitarios.

El señor Julio Armando O. O. ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus obligaciones y dedicado a la preparación de sus hijos para que en un futuro sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Julio Armando O. O. is employed as a treasurer by the city of Chinandega; he’s married and has three children, only one of whom, who is a university student, is still under his care. He has collaborated with CEPRODEL for five years and this has been an enormous help to him in paying for his other two children’s professional preparation; both have finished their university studies. Julio Armando O. O. has proven to be a responsible person who is dedicated to preparing his children so that they will be upstanding citizens in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his son's university fees and for school supplies.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Some is 53 years old and lives in Ta Skor Village in Kandal Province. She is a pig breeder who earns a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy two mother pigs to increase her business activities. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Sam Some is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy two mother pigs

loans.name: Sarly

texts.es:
La Sra. Sarly es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 44 años de edad està casada y tiene dos hijos .
Tiene una casa de equipamiento para vehiculos, y tambien venden colchones y camas, en donde atiende con su marido, el señor Jorge Speranza, con una buena clientela, ya que son los ùnicos que se dedican en ese ramo dentro de la ciudad.
 Su proyecto para mas adelante es habilitar otra sucursal en el centro de la ciudad, para cubrir y mejorar la atenciòn a sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de auto radios y parlantes, y otros accesorios para autos ya que de esa manera brindará mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sarly is from the city of Santani, is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She has an automobile parts store and also sells mattresses and beds. She attends to the store with her husband, Jorge Speranza, and they have good customers since they are the only ones in the city who do this activity. Her project to grow her business is to set up another branch in the center of the city to have better coverage and give better service to her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase radios, speakers, and other automobile parts since this way she will provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of radios, speakers, and other automobile parts.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 27-year-old box manufacturer.  He makes boxes for people in a busy market area and sells to people in town and even outside of the country.  He has been in this business for 6 years and has 3 employees. 

Charles plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture boxes.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

In the future, he hopes to have a much bigger business where he can accommodate all his customers’ requirements.  In 5 years, he dreams of being self-sufficient with a much higher income.

Charles describes himself as hard-working, industrious, determined, and someone who is focused to attain his goals.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture boxes

loans.name: Aide Plus Group

texts.en:
Aide Plus is a group of owners of small businesses chaired by Lyly K.. It is composed of 27 members who are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
Lyly K. is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children whose ages are between 1 and 14 years old. Two of them attend school.
She sells loaves of bread at the market located at the heart of Kinshasa. Lyly has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1999. Her business is developing progressively. Lyly is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying two racks of loaves of bread and reselling them at a profit with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $35 per week. Her ambition is to someday open a pastry business.

loans.use: increasing her inventory by buying two racks of loaves of bread and reselling them at a profit

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou C. T. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo. She lives in the province of Battambang in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs and crops. Since 2000, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her present standard of living. She is married with five children who are secondary students. Her husband owns a motorcycle that he uses to provide a taxi service. 

In order to earn extra income, Phou C. T. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Yuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna Y. is a village bank president who is 48 years old, selected by fourteen members whom all are made up a village bank loan located in Char village in Takeo province. All the members will use portion of the loan for varied ways to support their businesses in the current year. She is a tailor who sews gloves for her customers in which it can earn some money to support her family and she is also a pig breeder. Since her all businesses are going well she wants to increase her face businesses. So to improve those both goals, Mrs. Vanna Y. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets and fabric to sew gloves for her customers. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is attending in local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Jubilee

texts.en:
Jubilee A. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 21 years old, married, and has one infant child. Jubilee owns and operates a business engaged primarily in fish vending. The main source of income for the business comes from selling of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jubilee has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Jubilee joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Jubilee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jubilee is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing materials. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jubilee from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ HATUN SONCCO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es él Sr. César, él tiene  27 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus hermana mayor; El socio se dedica al comercio, él socio tenía un pequeño cafetín en la universidad andina, le a ido muy bien pero decidió después de muchos años cambiar de negocio y de este modo él socio alquiló un stand en puerto Maldonado y lleva ropa para vender, él socio también fue chofer de autos prestando servicio de taxi durante años,  El socio desea  ahora continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa en Puerto Maldonado.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar y vender ropa.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
César belongs to the community bank "Hatun Soncco", which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, in the state of Cusco. César is 27 years old, single, and lives with his older sister. He dedicates himself to running a small cafe in La Universidad Andina. This has gone very well but after many years, he has decided to change his business. He rented a stand in the Maldonado port and now sells clothing. He is also a driver and has offered a taxi service for many years. Now, César wishes to continue with his business of selling clothing in Port Maldonado. He is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing and selling clothing. César is thankful for and values the loan offered to him and promises to comply with the payment of his installments according to the timeline established.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in a new business of purchasing and selling clothing

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane H. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 20 years old and is married with one infant child. Mary Jane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita Q. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 51 years old. Lolita is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn K., 31, is single and resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. K. manufactures traditional sculptures to sell, earning an income of about USD 25 per day. 

K. has to spend USD 80 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 300 on other necessary expenses every month.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more sand and cement to expand his current business. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement to improve the sculpture business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda G. is from the village of Tagbocboc, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Glenda is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish like milkfish, mackerel, and salmon in the local community. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Glenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to buy and sell. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the fish business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Glenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the fish business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Liza is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling home made chorizzo or sausage in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month in this activity.

In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mireya Yankarla

texts.es: La señora Mireya dedicada al servicio de transcripción en su domicilio realiza este servicio para todos los estudiantes que frecuentan por la zona ya que existe una universidad muy cerca de su domicilio, las personas que requieren este servicio ya la conocen a la señora por eficiencia y rapidez para transcribir y realizar trabajos de investigación, Con este trabajo ayuda a su esposo para poder sostener a la familia con alimentación su familia que es numerosa y requieren muchas necesidades, una de estas es una lavandería en su casa motivo por el cual solicita el crédito para la construcción de la lavandería, la Sra. Mireya esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mireya provides transcription services from her home.  She provides this service to all the students who are in her area since there is a university very near to her home.  The people who require this service already know Mireya for her efficiency and speed in transcribing and carrying out research work.  Through her work, Mireya helps her husband to support and feed their large family who have a lot of needs, one of which is a laundry in their home.  Mireya is requesting this loan so that she can build a laundry.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support which they have provided.

loans.use: To build a laundry in her home

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine C. is from the village of Lower Inuman. She is 23 years old and married. To make a living she plants and harvests vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, such as manure

location.town: Sindangan-Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Keth

texts.en: Keth R. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Kompong Thom Province. She sells soft drinks, fast food, sweets, shampoo, and plastic products in front of her house. She makes an income of approximately $2 per day for using in the family’s expenses. She has been married for many years to Ros Put, 30, a hairdresser in the local market.  They have two children, all of whom are studying in public school. Keth R. runs her business very well due to the good public relations skills she uses with her customers.  Keth R. wishes to increase her capital as a fund to buy more inventories, such as shampoo, plastic products, and other necessary items, which she will then sell. She hopes to use the rest of funding to decorate her old house and to pay construction fees. These are the reasons she has decided to apply for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, plastic products, and other necessary for selling.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olga; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa en forma independiente, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar uso personal para el mantenimiento de su casa.   
           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Working Mothers” Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, located in the Cusco Province in the department of Cusco. 
This member is Mrs. Olga. She is 35 years old, has a partner and a one-year-old child. This member changes her activities daily. She buys and sells clothes as an independent contractor. She sells her clothes in different places such as institutions and to the general public. She would like to grow her business. She is asking for a loan for personal use for the maintenance of her house.
This member of the cooperative is happy to receive the loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: She is asking for this loan for personal uses, for the maintenance of her home.

loans.name: Mrs. Kun Roeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The eleven people who make up this village bank loan group have selected Mrs. K. R., to become their village bank president. They are located in Pris Leu village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their standard of living. 

Mrs. K. R. is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family and she is also a pig breeder. Since her second business is getting on well, she wants to expand it. So Mrs. K. R. is applying for a loan to buy more five piglets and pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Riem Kum, is a palm juice collector who can earn some money from selling  palm sugar to support his family. Through these activities, they support two children, one of whom is employed in garment factory. The other is a student in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more five piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
In this village bank loan there are fourteen members.  They are located in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sem Y. was bO. in 1975 and is amarried woman.  She was selected to be the village bank leader by the other members. 

Her husband, Mr. Oun Sán was bO. in 1973 and works as a teacher.   He is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has five children who are students and also support their mother's farming. 
 
Mrs. Sem Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice, cO. and vegetables to sell to support the family.  She doesn’t have enough money to increase farm production, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline, and to pay to hire laborers to plow her farm to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline, and to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mamie I.. She is married and has three children aged 2, 3, and 7. 

In 2005, Mamie established her fabric business. Her business is located in the busy commercial district of Bo city. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,411,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of  4,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional bails of wax cotton, satin and lace. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 282,200 SLL. 

In the future, Mamie plans to open a new business in another location and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional bails of cloth for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

For the past four years, she has operated a second-hand sales business as wholesale, retail and from door-to-door, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Esther faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Djama Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne de 36 ans, 3 enfants et habitant toutes le quartier Médine dans la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités commerciales au marché Médine Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de jus locaux, potasse, gingembre, poudre de pain de singe et calebasses. 
Dans le but de satisfaire la clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire. 
Madame Kadidia D. est une vendeuse de poudre de pain de singe dans le marché Médine Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  500kg de poudre de pain de singe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de Dougabougou, Binguebougou et Guassola. Elle revend  à domicile et au  marché Médine Ségou. Sa clientèle est  composée essentiellement de femmes.  Elle vend au comptant et à crédit. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer l’entretien des enfants et contribuer à certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Tièssiri group all married group, mainly living in monogamous families. They are on the average 36 years old, with three children, and all live in the Médine district in the town of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali), and they know each other as neighbors, relatives as well as through their common commercial activities at the Médine  market in Ségou.

The group members sell local juices, potash, ginger, powdered baobab fruit and gourds. In the goal of meeting the ever growing dcustomer emand, they joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 6th solidarity loan.

Mrs. Kadidia D. sells powdered baobab fruit at the Médine  market in Ségou. She plans to use her goal to purchase 500 kg of powdered baobab fruit. She stocks up in the villages of Dougabougou, Binguebougo and Guassola. She resells out of her home and at the Médine market in Ségou. Her customer base is composed mainly of women. She sells for cash and on credit. She hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 26,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for her children’s needs and contribute to some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase powdered baobab fruit

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza mujer trabajadora, que durante varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, chinelas de dama y caballeros. El cual tiene nueve años de haber establecido su negocio, iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería, hoy en día en Afodenic sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos.
Esperanza ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco con ayuda de su esposo, siendo de pocos recursos económicos. Es por eso tiene mucha dedicación a su pequeño negocio ya que logra apoyar a su familia.
Comprara con su nuevo financiamiento, zapatos de dama y caballeros, sandalias, chinelas estilo veranera, así como encargos que tiene de sus clientas. Siendo el objetivo aumentar la inversión.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a hard-working woman who has been selling men's and women's clothes, shoes and thongs (flip flops) for several years.  She set up her business nine years ago and started out making small purchases of merchandise.  Today, with the help of Afodenic, her sales levels have increased and she offers a greater variety of merchandise at competitive prices.

Esperanza has been gradually improving the infrastructure of her home with her husband's help as they have limited financial resources.  She is very committed to her small business as it helps her to support her family.

Esperanza will use her new loan to buy men's and women's shoes, sandals and summer thongs (flip flops).  She will also fill some orders that her customers have made.  Her goal is to increase her investment.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes and a variety of summer sandals, in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Rosas De Belen Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE BELEN” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chamarras, tejido de chompas, venta de chompa, venta de helado, venta de comida, venta de ají, comedera, venta de aceite.

La señora Juana, indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja con Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompa de alpaca que aprendió de su suegra hace seis años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de lana y conos de alpaca, que adquirirá de la feria 16 de Julio(lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Posterior a la elaboración de las chompas las vende a su cuñada, quien las acomoda en tiendas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta pagar puntual
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Belen” (Roses of Bethlehem) Communal Bank is beginning its 4th loan cycle as part of the “Centro Alto Lima” (Upper Lima Center). It is composed of 8 members, directed by a board headed by Juana. The businesses that the communal association's members carry out are varied; among them are: selling sheepskin jackets, yarn for sweaters, sweaters, ice cream, meals, garlic, cooking oil, and, also, an eatery.

Juana tells us that she has worked with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) during 2 loan cycles. At present, she has a business knitting alpaca sweaters. She learned to do this from her mother-in-law some 6 years ago.

The loan Juana now seeks is to buy wool and cones of alpaca yarn, which she will acquire at the “16 of July” Fair (a commercial location in the city of El Alto). After knitting the sweaters she sells them to her  brother-in-law who places them in stores. The form of work permits Juana to generate income to help her family, including 2 children, as much as possible. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes to pay punctually.

loans.use: to buy wool and cones of alpaca yarn for knitting sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a computer gaming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy another unit for her business. Estela has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income selling dried fish. She has kept her business going through her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy another unit for her computer-games business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with 12 children. Two of his children attend school, three have cleared school and seven are working. They live at a house that they own, which does not have electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for his family. 

For the past year, he has operated a water distribution business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. Samuel faces a major challenge of water rationing by the water company, hence not meeting his customers' demand. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase water pumps for his water distribution business. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase water pumps for his water distribution business

loans.name: Fuamai

texts.en:
Fuamai is 32 years old and she is a single female with no child. Fuamai owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Fuamai needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase farming equipments such as knives, spade and weed killer.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Fuamai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuamai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipments such as knives, spade and weed killer

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is married with one child. Hilario is 75 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Hilario sells goods  to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 4000 to purchase more different dried fish for her retail store.

Hilario has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail store

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosel is 53 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosel has a business in the Philippines buying and selling bananas. Rosel requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Rosel has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Rosel would like to save enough money to buy farm land and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other equipment.

Hayde has been in this business for 12 years. Hayde earns more income from food vending.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is an honest and hardworking 40-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been selling fabric for the last year to make a living. Previously, she used to sell cereals. 

She wants in the next five years to have a self-sustaining business that operates on wholesale terms. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for sale. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for boosting her business financially.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and daughter in Ho C. Minh city.

Binh’s has been running a coffee shop for three years. He plans to use this loan to buy more furniture to renovate his shop and buy more coffee and beverages for selling.

Binh hopes that through the loan he will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in his shop and adequately cover his family's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy more furniture to renovate his shop and buy more coffee and beverages for selling.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 5 children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  Ronald has a business of selling clothes, which he has had for 6 years.  He also sells shoes as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ronald hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Ronald hopes to open up another business.    Ronald is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by allowing him to get a loan easily, which is not the same with other institutions.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es:
Felix Angel tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijo vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Felix  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Felix Angel is 35, single, and has 2 children.  He lives alone in the town of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

This communal bank is called, "El Placer," and belongs to the town of Chillanes in the parish of San José del Tambo.  It is located 60 minutes from the office.  In this branch, there are 24 members that make a living through agriculture and growing plantains, rice, yucca, cacao, soy, and oranges.  They also raise poultry.

Felix grows rice, corn, oranges, soy, and plantains.  He buys his supplies in San José del Tambo and sells his crops at the Chillanes market on Sundays.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers.  This loan will help him as support to improve his harvest.  He does not face difficult challenges.  His dream is to have his own home.

In his free time, he likes to play sports with his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith integrante del Banco comunal “Los Jardines” perteneciente a la localidad de Villa Alemana. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo flores desde hace seis años de manera independiente. 
Las flores las compra en un terminal, cerca de la panamericana norte, ciudad de Santiago. Su horario de trabajo son los fines de semana y festivos. Comenta que las temporadas de más alta demanda son para las festividades, por lo que su trabajo se acrecienta y se ve con la necesidad de contratar más personal. Preferentemente sus sobrinos. 
Su negocio cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, entre las cuales se encuentran las demás emprendedoras del Banco comunal. Edith también cuenta con el servicio de pedidos y entrega a domicilio, dependiendo la festividad.
Edith también cuenta con una florería en un parque, en el cual ofrece y vende sus flores. 
Con el crédito comprará flores, para abastecer su negocio. 
Sus metas en su negocio son generar mayores ganancias para invertir en una camioneta, que le permita trasladar su mercadería cuando necesite comprar. 
Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 16 y 2 años de edad. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a las ganancias que le brinda, ya que además le permite otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Edith está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido estabilizarse económicamente, lo que le ha generado mayor seguridad. La relación con el grupo del Banco Comunal ha sido muy grata, ya que ha recibido el apoyo de las demás socias en momentos cruciales de su vida. Respecto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han permitido incorporar nuevos aprendizajes y a mejorar la administración de su negocio. 
Villa Alemana es una comuna ubicada en la provincia de Marga Marga, región de Valparaíso, zona central de Chile. Es conocida como la "ciudad de los molinos", por la gran cantidad de casas quinta que necesitaban sacar agua a través de molinos. 
También se la conoce como la “Ciudad de la Eterna Juventud”, por su clima templado, muy benigno, que la caracteriza de la siguiente manera "por su clima, la juventud no teme a la vejez. La vejez en Villa Alemana vive en eterna juventud". 
El nombre “Villa Alemana” se debe a que  fueron inmigrantes alemanes los primeros en comprar sitios e instalarse en este territorio.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the “Los Jardines” (The Gardens) Communal Bank in Villa Alemana.  She has been in the field of selling flowers in an independent manner for six years.  She buys the flowers at a terminal close to the Northern PanAmerican Highway in the city of Santiago.

She works on the week-ends and holidays.  She says that there is the most demand during the holiday seasons.  Therefore, her work has increased.  It is evident that she needs to hire more personnel, preferably her nieces and nephews.

Her business has a lot of customers; the other enterprising members of the communal bank are among them.  Edith also takes orders and provides home delivery, depending on the holiday.  Edith also has a flower shop in a park where she sells flowers.

Her business goal is to generate more income in order to invest in a van, which will allow her to transport her merchandise when she needs to buy.

She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 16 and 2.  Her motivation for continuing with the business is due to the earnings it provides.  It also allows her to give her family a better quality of life.

Edith is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanze has provided.  It has allowed her to become financially stable, which has produced greater security.  The relationship with her communal bank group has been very nice.  She has received the support of the other members during very crucial times in her life.  In regards to the trainings, they have allowed her to incorporate new knowledge and to improve the management of her business.

Villa Alemana is a community located in the province of Marga Marga, in the Valparaíso region in the central part of Chile. It is known as the "city of the mills", because of the large number of country homes that need to get water by means of mills. It is also known as the "City of Eternal Youth", for its temperate and pleasant climate, which is reflected in the following saying: " because of its climate, the young people are not afraid to grow old. The old people in Villa Alemana live in eternal youth."

The name “Villa Alemana” (German Villa) is due to the fact that German immigrants were the first to buy places and establish themselves in this territory.

loans.use: to buy flowers to stock her business.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced. She has a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine, where she sells clothing merchandise in one of the local marketplaces. Nina is an experienced entrepreneur. She has been in this business for 13 years. Currently, she has about 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly gross income amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Nina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase the variety of assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to continue developing her business to ensure a stable future for her family. Nina hopes her business remains stable so she can continue supporting her daughter and grandson as well as her elderly father who is 91 years old and lives with her.

loans.use: to increase the variety of assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Anuar

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Mandjacaze, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta  seus pais que  vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Mandjacaze para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, é pensionista militar ha mais de 17 anos e tem pensão de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro  emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros).  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para concluir a sua casa e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Anuar was born in the district of Mandjacaze, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of six children, four of whom still attend school. He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his parents, who live with him.

He left Mandjacaze for Boane in search of a better life. He has been retired from the military for more than 17 years and earns a pension of 4,500 meticals a month. He uses the pension to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He's had loans from other banks, which he paid off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 14,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Emina

texts.ru: Емина жительница района Дж. Руми. Она замужем. Ей 59 лет.  У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве, прорабом. Сама она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. В основном она занимается торговлей овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 30 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Emina is a resident of the region J. Rumy. She is 59 years old and married. She has two children. Her husband is a farm foreman, while Emina works as a seller at the central market. Mainly, she sells vegetables. She has worked as a seller for 30 years. She is applying for a loan in order to increase turnover.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 20 años, es una joven muy bueno, amable y muy trabajador. Es soltero ya que aún desea trabajar mucho para tener sus cosas y así recién poder tener un compromiso. Vive en casa de su madre en donde comparte sus días a lado de ella, su padre y sus hermanos quienes aún son menores y él apoya en algunas cosas. EL trabajo de Segundo consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajero dentro y fuera de la ciudad, de acuerdo  donde el cliente quiera ir, él esta dispuesto a llevarlo. Se siente muy feliz con su trabajo, ya que lo considera como un trabajo honrado, y sin tener que hacer cosas fuera de la ley. Lleva siendo Mototaxista ya por dos años aproximadamente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que el dispone de su horario, y para tener un control de sus actividades él se pone metas. Como todo joven tiene muchos planes como el de comprarse un mototaxi más, ya que le permitirá tener ingresos adicionales. Este será el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete en ser muy puntual en sus cuotas ya que en el banco al que pertenece los demás socios son muy responsables y él aprende de ellos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas y accesorios para mejorar las condiciones de su mototaxi, además pagará al mecánico que le hará todo el trabajo que necesita su mototaxi.
texts.en:
20-year-old Segundo is a very nice, kind and hard-working young man.  He is single as he still wants to work a lot so that he can have things.  He lives in his mother's house where he spends his days with her, his father and his siblings.  His siblings are still young and he supports them in some things.  

Segundo's business is transporting cargo and passengers both inside and outside the city.  Wherever the customer wants to go, he is prepared to take them.  He feels very happy with his work as he considers it to be a decent job and it doesn't involve doing anything illegal.  He has been a motorcycle taxi driver for approximately two years now.  What he likes about his work is that he can set his own hours and, in order to be in control of his activities, he sets himself goals.  Like all young people, Segundo has many plans such as buying himself another motorcycle taxi which will allow him to make additional income.

This will be Segundo's second loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can continue reaching his goals.  For his part, he pledges to be very punctual in making his repayments as the members of his community bank are very responsible people and he learns from them.  Segundo will use the sum he has requested to buy spare parts and accessories to improve the condition of his motorcycle taxi.  He will also pay the mechanic to do all the work that needs doing on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to take his motorbike to the mechanic and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Margalita

texts.en:
Margalita is from the village Khandaki, East Georgia. She is 56 years old and lives with her 21 year-old son in the village. Margarita’s son works in a local bread factory. Margalita earns a living through agricultural activities. In particular, she has 2 milk cows and 5 calves. Margalita produces cheese and sells  30 kg of cheese monthly in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). She will sell calves in spring, when they are already grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Margalita requested a loan for purchasing feed for cows and calves for the winter months. She will purchase quality natural food and will count on a high yield of milk during the winter season, which will have a positive impact on family income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows and calves

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gtashen.  She is the proud mother of three wonderful children: two daughters (19 and 21 years old) and a 20-year-old son.  Alvard works hard to support her family and also helps her close relatives.  She has a high school education and has been a farmer for 20 years.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and fuel.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase her income by 20 percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and the loan collection process.  Alvard’s capital investment in her business is five times her outstanding loans.



About the Field Partner – AREGAK Universal Credit Organization
In the fall of 1997, United Methodist Committee on Relief (UMCOR) established the AREGAK microfinance program, with the purpose to create economic opportunities for low income people who have no or limited access to the formal financial sources, especially in the remote rural areas. The microfinance program rapidly became one of the largest MFI in Armenia in terms of number of active clients and portfolio size.

In March of 2006, AREGAK UCO was registered as a Universal Credit Organization, structured as a Closed Joint Stock Company with UMCOR as the sole shareholder.
Today, AREGAK UCO provides a broad range of financial services to the population without compromising the social aspects of its mission and continues initiatives geared toward the fulfillment of its ethical principles

Vision Statement
To be the most dynamic and ethical financial institution in Armenia and Nagorno Karabagh.

Mission Statement
AREGAK supports the economic development of small and medium entrepreneurs with high quality, accessible and reliable financial services.

AREGAK UCO’s Ethical Principles
1. Integrity and Excellence
We deliver on our promises
We are honest and transparent in everything we do
We provide excellent customer service
2. Respect and Inclusion
Our leadership, workforce and decision-making reflect and respect the diversity of customers and communities we serve.
We value all employees, investing in their personal and professional growth.
3. Innovation
We develop new processes and systems to improve efficiency
We create value added new products to enhance economic opportunities

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Marzouka

texts.en:
Marzouka is an unmarried 28-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and five siblings, two of whom are still in school while the other three work. Marzouka is doing the best she can to offer a good life to her family. She started her own farming business in 2008, and she has eight years of work experience in agriculture. She cultivates fresh, natural vegetables.

Marzouka wants to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. She believes that her harvest will be as good as the care she gives to her land. In the future, she plans to open her own vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ritia

texts.en:
Ritia is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling fish in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Ritia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Sereyny

texts.en:
Sereyny (pictured here) is 41 years old and her husband, Sokhan, is 52 years old. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter; two are in school and one is still young. 

Sereyny is a high school teacher. Her husband is a musician and also operates a business renting out sets of musical instruments to villagers in his village and the nearby province. 

One particular set of musical instruments is usually called Ork Kes in Khmer. The people in the countryside prefer to rent Ork Kes to entertain in weddings, some religious ceremonies, and especially before and during Khmer New Year. Most people rent Karaoke to sing and dance both in the pagoda and inside their houses, and now there are lots of weddings and religious ceremonies.

Sereyny is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s musician business by buying a piano and materials needed for his business.
