loans.use: To buy a piano and materials needed for her husband’s business as a musician.

loans.name: Hend

texts.en:
Hend is a 26 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Sahab Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy for materials to make cheese and yogurt to sell, She wants to increase her products. In the future she would like to open a shop behind her home to sell her products and she hopes to increase her income. 
Since Hend is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.
Hend is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband.

loans.use: to buy for materials to make cheese and yogurt to sell

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Argie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Argie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna is married with three children.Two are in primary school and one in secondary school.She lives in Mbagala,the area which is on the outskirts of the city of Dar es Salaam. She runs a hairdressing saloon in a busy area of the city center.She has seven years in this business.Maimuna had a training in hairdressing in Nairobi city of nearby country of Kenya.Maimuna has developed a strong relationship with her regular customers which need not be broken. She is planning to add more stock of hairdressing materials and Driers.She want to shield herself against stockouts on this coming Christmas season.Christmas is the period when she expects higher revenues.She has also started selling women cloths in her salon.When customers are in the queue waiting for  service they get a chance of looking on these cloths,they usually buy.She also need to add the stock of these cloths too.Maimuna need also to add some chairs for customers to wait while in queue.To enable her implement these plans Maimina requests USD 1000.

loans.use: BUYING HAIRDRESSING MATERIALS

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
My name is Patrocinia, and I purchase and sell watches, chains, rings, and other products. At this time I need funds to be able to buy and sell products to my clients. Because of my age I need a job that sustains my personal expenses, including health. My clients are young office workers and businesses that purchase accessories to offer as gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Me llamo Patrocinia y me dedico a la compra y venta de relojes, aritos, cadenas, anillos y otros productos. En este momento necesito capital de trabajo para poder comprar productos y vender a mis clientes. Por mi edad necesito un trabajo que pueda cubrir mis gastos personales, y de salud. Mis clientes son jovenes de oficinas, o de negocios quienes me compran accesorios para embellecer su personalidad.

loans.use: Purchase of watches and plating accessories.

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia is 57 years old and has six children. She is separated from her husband who was abusive and an alchoholic. She works sewing and embroidering blouses and also bakes bread which she sells in places close to her home. With this loan she plans to buy more basic materials to continue sewing blouses and baking bread. She is part of the Grupo Santa Catarina 3.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

ELIA TIENE 57 AÑOS, SEIS HIJOS, ES SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO POR CAUSA DEL MAL TRATO Y EL ALCOHOL. ELLA TRABAJA CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS Y BORDANDOLAS Y TAMBIEN ELABORA PAN Y LO VENDE EN LUGARES CERCANOS A SU LOCALIDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA MAS MATERIA PRIMA PARA SEGUIR CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS Y TAMBIEN TODO LO NECESARIO PARA SEGUIR PREPARANDO PAN. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 3.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Ceveriano

texts.es:
Mr. Ceveriano T. G. is 59 years old and married with 4 children, aged 28, 26, 24 and 8. The youngest child is currently in school while the older children are all working. One of the children is a degreed systems analyst, another is an engineer working in electronics and another works in topography. All of the children help the family with their earnings, in a lovely show of filial reciprocity.

Ceveriano works with his wife in a small stall that they opened in the Municipal Market of their city; they sell all kinds of products including lettuce, tomatoes, onions, carrots, etc. They have been in retail businesses for 20 years; 8 years ago they were able to open their own fixed stall in the market.

They have very good sales, thanks to the location of their sales stall. People come to the market every day to buy necessities while others that work in the area come to eat lunch in the market's restaurants. A few months ago they started selling "family budget baskets", which are baskets of preselected varied items sold for a affordable price.

Every morning their work day begins at 5 AM to be ready to open the sales stall at 6 AM. Ceveriano and his wife work alone, just the two of them, except on Sundays when they have an additional employee to help them sine demand is much higher on Sunday.

They need a loan to be able to stock the stall with more seasonal products, such as onions, potatoes and tomatoes, along with eggs and chickens. The sales of the family basket is a complete success and they continually see more demand for the product.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Ceveriano T. G. tiene 59 años de edad, está casado, y tiene cuatro hijos de 28, 26, 24 y 8 años respectivamente. El menor está actualmente en la escuela y los mayores están todos trabajando. Uno de ellos es un licenciado analista de sistemas, otro es un ingeniero quién se dedica a la electrónica y el último se dedica a la topografía. Todos los hijos ayudan a la familia con sus ingresos así dando un lindo sentido de reciprocidad filial.

El Señor trabaja con su señora en un pequeño local que abrieron en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad, en donde vende toda clase de productos tales como lechuga, tomate, cebolla, cebolla de hoja, zanahoria, etc. Están hace 20 años metidos en el negocio de comerciantes y hace tan solo 8 años que lograron poner su puesto fijo de ventas en el mercado.

Tienen muy buenas ventas, gracias a la zona comercial en la que se encuentra, pues la gente acude todos los días al mercado a proveerse de los artículos de primera necesidad, al igual que personas que trabajan por la zona y van a almorzar a los comedores del mercado. Hace unos meses implementaron la venta de “canastas familiares económicas” que consiste en la venta de productos variados pre seleccionados dentro de una canasta a un precio económico. Todas las mañanas empieza su día laboral a las 5 de la mañana para abrir su local a las 6. Trabajan solo los dos, excepto los domingos, cuando emplean a un personal ya que la demanda es siempre mayor ese día de la semana. Requieren del préstamo para así poder abastecerse más con productos de la temporada, tal como la cebolla, papa y tomate así como también huevos y pollos, pues la venta de la canasta familiar es todo un éxito y cada vez tienen más demanda de los mismos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise including onions, potatoes, tomatoes, chicken and eggs in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Kleang

texts.en: Mrs. Kleang ChanT., 58, lives with her husband and two children and one grandchild in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, together, work on their plot of farmland growing rice crops and a various types of vegetables and typically make around $2 each day. One of her children is married and works as a farmer as well. In order to make a good profit, this couple hopes to use this loan to purchase bananas from somebody else's plantation and then resell them at a good price

loans.use: To purchase bananas to resell at a good price

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Mr. Sour E. was married in 1979 and has 6 children, 4 sons and 2 daughters. Since 2002 he has run a business renting a microphone and a generator for various kinds of ceremonies. His wife runs another business, planting and selling flowers. Neither husband nor wife completed primary education. Three of their sons are married and have moved to live in different houses. The fourth helps his mother in planting flowers for the business, while the remaining two daughters are working in a garment factory 

He is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time with for the amount of $500. He will use this loan to purchase another generator to expand his existing hiring business.

loans.use: to purchase another generator to expand his existing hiring business.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat Z. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 4 children. She has a shop in the Rokhy Abreshim bazaar and sells food products, including tea and oil. She has a great variety of products, and repeat customers. She has been in this business for 21 years.

Working in Rokhy Abreshim bazaar, Rafoat Z. has stiff competition and that is why she wants to expand the variety of goods she offers for the New Year holiday purchases.

She has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2006. Now she requests a loan of 3500 TJS (about $1025) to expand the variety of products that she offers.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Kawala Central A Group

texts.en: Betty is 44 years old and is married with seven children. She owns and runs a small grocery store. She would like to use the extra profits to start up a piggery business.

loans.use: To expand the grocery goods she sells.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mrs. Prum D., 24, is a mother of two little children and lives in ChamKar Tamoa village, Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at her home selling cooked beef and pork to the people in her area, making on average around $2 each day of profit. Her husband is meanwhile self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and typically makes about $4/day of income. Therefore, her mother-in law, who lives with her, also helps supplement her household by operating a karaoke business. Mrs. Prum D. hopes to use this loan to purchase wine and beer to serve in her stand, due to her customer demand, and the leftover of the loan she will use to buy more meat for her business. (Her husband, 29, is pictured because Mrs. Prum D. was unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase wine and beer to serve in her stand, due to her customer demand, and the leftover of the loan she will use to buy more meat for her business.

loans.name: Udelia

texts.es:
Doña Udelia is very valiant and vigorous; her desire to elevate the level of living of her beloved family has led her down many different paths. She cultivates fodder in a small plot of land in order to offer it to the cattle ranchers and small animal breeders of her beautiful city; she also loans out a piece of land and finally due to her facination with weaving, she creates some garments sporadically with the objective of offering them in her travels. The request for a loan attends to the betterment of the quality and quantity of the produce that she sows.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Udelia, es muy valiente y esforzada, su deseo de elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia la ha conducido por diversos caminos. Cultiva forraje en una pequeña parcela de tierra para ofertarla a los ganaderos y criaderos de animalitos de su bella ciudad, también otorga en alquiler un espacio de tierra y finalmente debido a su fascinación por el tejido elabora algunas prendas esporádicamente con el objetivo de ofertarla en sus viajes.La solicitud de un préstamo atiende a mejorar la calidad y cantidad del producto que siembra.

loans.use: Increase the quality and quantity of the fodder she grows. - Incrementar la calidad y cantidad del forraje.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im M. is 44 years of age and has been farming rice since 1998. She makes approximately US $1.60 per day. Her husband raises pigs earning US $1 daily. They have had seven children together, only one of whom is married. One of the older children helps the family by collecting juice from sugar palm trees to be refined into local wine. He adds US $2 per day to the family income. Two others help their father with the pigs. With her loan, Im M. hopes to buy more pigs for her husband to breed. She also wants to invest in a small grinding mill for food production that she can also rent out to her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a grinding mill

loans.name: Bunly Chroen Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunly C., the group leader, lives in Prek Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Bunly C. is a subsistence farmer. She has hired a laborer to plow her rice field, but unfortunately she does not have enough money to pay the wages. She would use her loan for this purpose and any remaining money would go towards fuel for her pump.

Mrs. Bunly C. is 34 years old and married with four children, one of whom is a fisherman like his father. Her other three children are enrolled in school.

Last year, Mrs. Bunly C. obtained a loan to buy fuel for the pump and fertilizer. Three years ago, Mrs. Bunly C. got a serious liver disease and the family spent $1000 on treatment.

loans.use: To pay wages and purchase fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of clothing to restock a small business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard-working woman who undertakes the hard manual labour of the fields. Year after year she worked as a day-labourer on other people’s lands: often they didn’t recognise the tremendous effort she made with the meagre pay they gave her. Because of this, five years ago Maria decided to dedicate herself entirely to the wholesale retail of carrots: she also sells alfalfa occasionally. Maria’s work consists of going to the cultivation fields at the time of the carrot harvest: after the washing process she selects them, packages them and then sells them wholesale in the wholesale market in Huancayo. In this way Maria is an important economic provider in her household, above all for her three children who are still studying. Maria’s wish is to obtain a loan in order to buy a larger quantity of carrots and thus increase her profits. If previously unkind people have taken advantage of Maria’s neediness, she has now learnt that with continued efforts it is possible to advance her family’s well-being by herself. Your help will be very valuable in her life, and something that she will never forget.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

María es una mujer muy trabajadora dedicada a las duras tareas del campo, año tras año trabajó como peón en otras tierras, muchas veces no compensaba el tremendo esfuerzo que hacía con el pago que le daban. Por ello hace 5 años atrás María decide dedicarse enteramente a la venta de zanahorias al por mayor, también se dedica a la venta de alfalfa de manera ocasional. El trabajo de María consiste en ir a los terrenos de cultivo para la cosecha de zanahoria, luego de un proceso de lavado las selecciona, encostala y así las vende al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de Huancayo. De esta manera María es un sostén importante para la economía de su hogar, sobre todo para sus 3 hijos que están estudiando. El deseo de María es obtener el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de zanahoria y obtener mayores ganancias. Si antiguamente personas desconsideradas se aprovechaban de la necesidad de María, ella ahora ha aprendido que con su esfuerzo y empeño puede sacar adelante a su familia por sí misma, tu apoyo sería muy valioso para su vida, algo que nunca olvidará.

loans.use: Maria needs to buy a larger quantity of carrots during the harvest in order to sell them in her local market

loans.name: Rukia's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Rukia H. is 30 years old and married with four children ages 17, 16, 10 and 8. She began selling food in 2006. Every day she works from 7a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $550.

Rukia now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this $1000 loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling clothing, food, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Carlos Florencio

texts.es:
Carlos U. paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre (ciudad de La Paz), en donde también tiene un taller de sastrería, con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa e hijos (es su única fuente de ingresos). Su solicitud de crédito es para adquirir material de trabajo ya que actualmente él remienda prendas pero ahora tiene planeado confeccionar trajes completos para ganar más dinero con sus ventas (en Bolivia los trajes hechos a medida son bien pagados debido al buen precio).

Es uno de nuestros clientes más antiguos y su historial es muy bueno,  por lo que aconsejamos ayudar a este micro empresario.
texts.en:
Carlos U. pays rent on his home located on Juan Granier Street in the zone of La Paz known as 14 de Septiembre (September 14). He has a tailoring workshop in his rented home. He supports his wife and children with the workshop; it is his only source of income. His loan application is for capital with which to buy working materials. Currently he does only alterations, but he plans to begin making complete suits in order to earn more money with his sales. In Bolivia, making custom suits to order pays well, thanks to the good price the tailor can charge for the final product.

Carlos is one of IMPRO's oldest clients. His credit history is very good; IMPRO recommends helping this microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria Maria es una pequeña comerciante que cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio 14 de Febrero de la ciudad de Managua. Es casada, y con cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene 4 hijos, dos varones y dos mujeres. El crédito solicitado es para reforzar el inventario de su pulpería ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario y quiere mantener la oferta, para así no perder a sus clientes. Su sueño como madre es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, para que ellos puedan tener una mejor vida, y puedan ser hombres útiles a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Maria is a small business woman who runs a local store at her place of residence. Her home is located in the neighborhood 14 of February in the city of Managua. She is married is helped by her husband to get her family ahead. She has 4 children; 2 boys and 2 girls. The requested loan is to reinforce the inventory in her store, since she is low in supplies right now and she would like to keep her sales up so she does not lose her clients. Her dream as a mother is to help her children succeed so that they can have a better life and can be productive members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata tiene 27 años, vive con su  esposo y su hija. Ella es una mujer que ha sabido levantarse a los malos tiempos, uno de ellos fue cuando tenía un negocio de cabinas de Internet, pero debido a un rayo que cayó en la antena que proporcionaba la línea al pueblo, y al no poderse reparar la antena, tuvo que vender sus computadoras y cerrar su negocio. Desde hace más de 2 años se dedica a ofrecer pequeños prestamos a personas conocidas con un interés bajo, de esa manera puede hacer crecer su dinero, esta opción es viable, porque necesita tiempo para su pequeña, la dificultad es cuando su hija se enferma, entonces que requiere de casi todo su tiempo para poder  cuidarla. Solicita este préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, ya que Honorata quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Honorata is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. She is a woman who has known bad times in her life, but has overcome them. One of these was when she provided an internet service. Unfortunately, a bolt of lightning hit the antenna which provided access to the internet for the village, and because she was not able to repair the antenna she had to sell her computers and close her business. For more than two years she has been offering small personal loans with low rates of interest to people she knows, and in this way has been able to increase her savings. This is a practical option for work as she needs free time to look after her young daughter, who is ill, and needs Honorata to spend almost all her time caring for her. Honorata is looking for this loan to improve the infrastructure of her home, as she would like to give her daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank, is 55 years old and married with five children. Paulina grows grains and potatoes on her land in the Chiara District of central Peru, which she travels to from Ayacucho on a weekly basis. She also has a small hostel on Bolognesi Avenue. Paulina is now requesting a loan to pay her farm workers. Her dreams are to expand her hostel and to finish building her house in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To pay farm workers.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia I. is fifty years old. She is married and has two children. Both are attending elementary school in Ejura, where they reside.

She is into selling food items such as beans, maize and groundnuts [peanuts]. She has been in this business for over thirty-five years now. Sadia said she started this business with her mother when she was a child. Sadia buys her goods from wholesalers in her community and sells to food vendors. She says she sells at the market square. 

Sadia wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her wish to buy goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, and hence, her profit margin.

Sadia belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Philippe

texts.fr: Né en 1973 à Lomé, Mr Philippe T. est marié et père de six (06) enfants avec quatre (04) autres personnes à charge. Eleveur très réputé de pondeuses et poulets de chair dans son milieu, il toujours travailler en collaboration avec des vétérinaires qualifiés et des agents techniques d’élevage et d’agriculture. Afin de renouveler son stock de pondeuses et acheter les provendes et médicaments, il sollicite un financement. Ce financement va lui permettre d’augmenter ses ventes quotidiennes d’œufs et augmenter ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Philippe T. was born in Lomé in 1973. He's married and the father of six children, and he has four additional persons to support. A well-known poultry and laying hens breeder in his community, he always work in connection with qualified veterinarians and technical breeder and agriculture agents. In order to renew his flock of laying hens, and to buy feed and medications, he's seeking a loan. This loan will enable him to increase his daily eggs sales, and its profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy laying hens, medications, and feed

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is married and raises two kids. Her family lives in Korolyovo. Erika sells souvenirs and gifts in one of the local markets. She has been in the trade for 3 years. Favorable location of her vending kiosk and few competitors in the field provide good potential for growth of Erika’s business. Currently, she has about 50,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her average monthly income is about 6,000 Grivnas.

Erika is very inventive. She manages to keep her business running smoothly even amidst the worst economic conditions. She balances reasonable prices, despite rate increases, and a variety of inventory that she offers for sale in her kiosk. Erika is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She believes that having this additional capital will help her minimize her sales risk and provide further stable financial support for her family. Moreover, it will help Erika get closer to her ultimate goal of expanding her trade one day.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Бадалов Мурод парень 32 лет, женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Мурод не имеет постоянной работы и подрабатывает на строительстве частных домов. Он является основным добытчиком семьи. Кроме своего основного занятия Мурод также занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота на местных рынках. Узнав про КИВА и изучив его условия Мурод решил подать заявку на получение займа. Это его первый опыт в кредитовании и на полученный займ он собирается увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Полученный займ собирается погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murod B. is 32 years old, married and has three children. He does not have a permanent job and works part-time doing home construction. He is the sole provider for his family. Besides his primary work, Murod has a business of buying and selling livestock at local markets. Having found out about Kiva and its lending terms, Murod decided to request a loan. This is his first experience with obtaining a credit. He plans to use this loan to increase his working capital. He will repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is a 27 year old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 27 years.  Her husband name is S. A. who has a rental motorbikes business.  He rents his motorbikes and charge the people per hour. Presently he has two motorbikes.  Sumera is the mother of one son who is just one year old.  Sumera manufactures thread chains by taking orders from goldsmiths. She prepares 6 dozens thread chains in a week and earns good income.  She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another motorbike for her husband’s motorbike rental business.

loans.use: Buy another motorbike for her husband's rental business.

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en:
Mrs. Georgia F. is a 43-year-old mother of eight. Her husband Leonardo is a baker. She does body massage to help support the family. Her irregular income plus her husband's limited income from baking is not enough to provide all the basic needs of their eight children. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to start a new venture, a livestock fattening project. 

Georgia applied for this loan to buy one cow and one pig for fattening to continue her business. She is very fortunate to have this opportunity for getting bigger capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to send her sons and daughters in school to get a degree for them to land a good job.

loans.use: To buy one cow and one pig for fattening

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Naomi has owned a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Naomi is married, and has four children: ages 22, 18, 15 and 11. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ruth, who owns her own small business selling charcoal in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una excelente esposa y madre, pues trata de siempre apoyar a sus seres queridos con quienes vive en su hogar, vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo logró obtener junto a su pareja. Sus ganas de progresar la llevaron a dedicarse a múltiples actividades, con las que pagaba los gastos de educación de sus hijos, quienes ya son profesionales, lo cual la llena de satisfacción. Pero sus deseos de crecer permanecen en ella, y con algo de dinero ahorrado logró comprar un carrito para de comida con el cual sale todas las noches a la puerta de su casa para ofrecer diversos aperitivos a los transeúntes, ya que tiene el beneficio de estar situada en un lugar de gran afluencia de personas. A pesar de atender sólo por las noches, no deja de ser fatigada su labor, pues durante el día tiene que realizar los diversos platillos y ensaladas que sus clientes están acostumbrados a consumir. Pero todo este esfuerzo tiene un fin, que es instalar un restaurante en su domicilio, donde pueda brindar todas las atenciones necesarias a sus clientes, quienes cada día la motivan a agilizar sus planes para que puedan visitarla con más frecuencia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y en los años de permanencias ha podido aprender a relacionarse con sus compañeras de grupo y dar soluciones en algunas circunstancias complicadas que se han presentado. Con los 1000 soles que solicita invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina y víveres para incrementar la preparación de los alimentos que ofrece.
texts.en:
María is an excellent wife and mother who always tries to support her loved ones. She lives with them in the house that she and her husband worked very hard together to obtain. Her desire to progress led her to multiple activities. These activities paid for her children’s education. The children are now professionals, and this fills her with satisfaction. But, her desire to grow remains. With some saved money she was able to buy a food cart, which she takes to the front of her house every night. She sells different snacks to the passers-by. She has the benefit of being located in a place where there are a lot of people. In spite of tending her cart just in the evenings, she is still tired from her work. During the day she makes different dishes and salads that her customers are used to eating. All of this work has an end, which is to have a restaurant in her home. There she could offer all of the necessary attention to her customers. Every day they motivate her to speed up her plans so that they can visit her more frequently. This is her third loan with MFP. In her years with them she has been able to learn how to relate with her colleagues in the group and how to find solutions to complex situations that have arisen. With the 1,000 PEN she will buy kitchen utensils and provisions to increase the amount of food that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils and provisions

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 41 years old and married with 4 children. Taiwo is a tailor and he makes good suits for his customers. He is requesting for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more tailoring materials to make more suits to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi Y. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé depuis 3 ans. Kossi souhaita avec ce crédit acheter son propre engin. Il utilisait depuis lors la moto d’autrui ce qui ne lui permettait pas d’épargner pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Kossi compte su cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi Y., age 29, is married and the father of one child. He's been a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé for 3 years. Kossi would like to use this loan to buy his own motorcycle. Until know, he's been using an other person's motorcycle, which does not enable him to save to provide for his family. Kossi counts on this opportunity to improve the standard of living of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Фотима - молодая женщина 26 лет. Замужем но пока детей не имеет. Фотима готовится стать матерью. Она вместе со своим мужем занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Её муж пасет овец, а она откармливает коров дома. У Фотимы есть дойная корова. Она употребляет молоко, а излишек продает соседям. Фотима и её муж просят займ для закупки мелко-рогатого скота, чтобы откормить его, и когда наступит праздник Курбан, продать подороже на рынке.
texts.en:
Fotima is a young 26-year-old woman. She is married, but does not yet have children. Fotima is preparing to become a mother. Fotima and her husband are involved in feeding and selling livestock. Her husband grazes sheep, and she feeds cows at home. Fotima has a dairy cow. She uses the milk and sells any excess to her neighbors. Fotima and her husband requested a loan in order to purchase small livestock to feed and sell at the market at a higher price during the Kurban holiday.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Pentecost Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 45 years old. She is a divorced woman with three children. All her children are in school. She is a baker who has been using flour for her production for 20 years now. She bakes bread and retails it to her customers. She supplies it by herself in the market center to her customers and people also take bulk delivery of bread from her.

Ernestina's only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Pentecost’. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: Nuwajuna Ruth is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 32 years old and married with three children who attend secondary or primary school. Ruth has been managing a salon for four years in Omukagyera Trading Centre.  Over the years she has been able to increase her monthly profits to 110,000 UGX. She is a loyal person and this has won her more customers.  Her goal is to expand the salon further so she can earn more profits which she will use to educate and care for her children. This is Ruth’s first loan with the group and she will use it to buy more salon equipment to expand her business and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment like dryers and combs.

loans.name: Ledelyn

texts.en:
Ledelyn D. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Ledelyn is married and has five school-aged children. For ten years, Ledelyn has owned and operated a manufacturing business. She manufactures  products like seweed rags which she sells to local businesses and community members. 

In 2009, Ledelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan for $125 to purchase additional inventory and improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 45 year old and married with 3 children. She owns restaurant where she sells drinks and cooked foods. She had been in the business for sometime now. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase refrigerator and drinks. She says thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator and drinks.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj S. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two eldest children work full time in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and the youngest son is a student in a local university.

Davaadorj has a small retail business in dairy products. She sells various dairy products including milk, cheese, cream, etc. She started this dairy retail business in 2005 and, since the beginning, she has been working on this business with her husband. The business has been quite successful and is now the main source of income for the family.

Since the start in 2005 Davaadorj’s business capital has increased from 80,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT (1 USD = 1.450 MNT). She says that she would like to grow his business into a sustainable family business.

Davaadorj requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products for her business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Soumaré une femme âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et a 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 ans. Avec son prêts elle vend du tissu teinté et des chaussures. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son petit commerce lui permettent de participer pour la nourriture et santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Soumaré is a 29-year-old married woman who has six children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years.  With her loans, she is selling shoes and dyed cloth.  The profits earned from her small business enables her to contribute to her children's nourishment and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital

loans.name: Maria Hortensia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tres Marías se encuentra a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad del mismo nombre en el sur de la ciudad, esta localidad goza de una belleza natural y biodiversidad por su lugar de ubicación, su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad o han migrado al extranjero para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
 
La señora  María León es socia del banco comunal Tres Marías, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre con su esposo y su madre de 88 años,  nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad y no tiene hijos ya que se casó a una edad madura (46 años)  mantiene  una buena relación conyugal con su esposo que trabaja como albañil, no tienen casa  propia porque viven en casa de su madre ya que ella se encarga del cuidado de ella debido a su avanzada edad y problemas de presión alta.

 María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también cría  pollos y cuyes, nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que todos sus pollos vende en la comunidad y los cuyes es para su consumo o cuando hay alguna necesidad los vende.

Lleva dos años trabajando con los prestamos que otorga la  fundación y con ellos montó un criadero de pollos y también le capacitaron en el sistema de ahorro;  con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de alimento y vitaminas  para sus pollos y cuyes, y una parte  para las necesidades de su hogar.

Su mayor sueño es que su madre se recupere de su enfermedad.
texts.en:
Tres Marías communal bank is located about 15 minutes south of the city of Cuenca in the community of the same name. This town boasts natural beauty and biodiversity because of its location. The adult population works in farming and the raising of livestock, while the young citizens work in the city or have moved abroad to earn better lives for their families. Mrs. María León is a member of Tres Marías communal bank, and lives in the community of the same name. She lives with her husband and her 88-year-old mother. María is 50 years old and has no children, as she married at a mature age (46). She has a good relationship with her husband who works as a mason. They do not have their own house, since they live in the home of María's mother, but María takes care of the house due to her mother's advanced age and high blood pressure. María takes care of the household chores and also raises chickens and guinea pigs. She tells us everything is going very well, as she can sell all the chickens in the community, and the guinea pigs provide food for the family, or can be sold if necessary. She has been receiving loans from the foundation for two years and with the funds she has built up a stock of chickens and also begun saving money. With the new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, María will invest in food and vitamins for her chickens and guinea pigs, and some money will be used for household needs. María's biggest dream is that her mother will recover from her illness.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed and vitamins for chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: S. Colette est née en 1978 à Bantè, dans le Nord du Bénin. Mariée à DINDIN Bernard, un mécanicien, Colette est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Colette vit avec son conjoint et ses enfants depuis trois ans à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Seul Bernard supporte les charges de la famille. Colette exerce le métier de couture depuis quatre ans déjà. Colette vend également dans son atelier situé à Cocotomey, des tissus et des articles de mercerie. Colette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Colette a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit de ALIDé qui a été bien remboursé. En vue d'accroître son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Colette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
S. Colette was born in 1978 in Bantè, in northern Benin. Married to DINDIN Bernard, a mechanic, she is the mother of two children who are all in school. She has been living with her husband and children for three years in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Bernard is the only one covering family expenses. Colette has been working in the sewing trade for four years already. She also sells cloth and sewing supplies in her workshop located in Cocotomey. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She has had an ALIDé loan before, which was repaid. With the aim of growing her business and satisfying her customers more, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 bolts of cloth, 8 boxes of sewing thread, 5 rolls of popliin

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Concepción Torres le está haciendo falta un cuarto pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora.
Doña concepción es madre de familia tiene a dos hijos pequeños a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor y desea ya tener su propio espacio en la casa. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y de ropa por catálogos, este ingreso sera para pagar el crédito y que los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el dinero que le manda su marido que se encuentra en los Estados Unidos trabajando.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Concepción Torres needs another room, but at this time she does not have the necessary money to be able to carry out the improvement. Señora Concepción is a mother with two small children. She wants to give them the best and would like them to each have their own space in the house. She is dedicated to the sale of beauty products and clothes from catalogues. This income will serve to repay the loan. She will cover the family expenses with the money that is sent by her husband, who is working in the United States.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin to add a room to her home

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eduardo se dedica  a realizar trabajos de joyería. Cuenta con  35 años esta casado con la Sra. Bonifacia Díaz de 35 años de edad, tienen un hijo de 5 años. 
Desde chico se dedico a trabajar en el taller de la  joyería de su tío, con los años fue adquiriendo experiencia y con su ahorros fue comprando las maquinas y herramientas que necesitaba para abrir un pequeño taller, en este momento cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes trabaja  especialmente para joyerías de renombre de la ciudad de Luque. 
Le gustaría mas adelante abrir una joyería en el centro de la ciudad  ya que cuenta con varios clientes, y que su hijo estudie para obtener un titulo ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo does jewelry work. He’s 35 years old and is married to Mrs. Bonifacia Díaz; they have a 5 year old son. Since he was a small boy, he worked in his uncle’s jewelry workshop; with the years he gained experience, and with his savings he started buying the machines and tools he needed to open a small workshop. At this moment, he has a good number of clients, and he mostly works with well known jewelry shops in the city of Luque. Looking forward, he would like to open a jewelry shop in the city’s downtown, leveraging his many clients, and he would like his son to study and get a degree since he did not have the opportunity to study in a university.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pure silver and tools used to make silver jewelry

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: T. Apollo is a 28-year-old businessman and father of three children. For the past five years, he has run a retail shop where he sells essentials. Apollo is using his loan to purchase retail items such as drinks, bread, sweets, soap, salt, sugar, etc. for sale. His future hopes are to expand his business, educate his children, and obtain a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as drinks, bread, sweets, soap, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 25 años de edad es soltero vive en la casa de su abuela juntamente con sus padres ellos viven en la Tinguiña en casa de material noble de un piso, el  cuenta con una moto taxi el cual adquirio con financiamiento del Crediscotia, el se inicio en esta actividad como chofer de moto, actualmente cuenta con vehiculo propio. Luis tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener  mas vehiculos, con el dinero que solicita relaizara mantenimiento general de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old. He is single and lives in his grandmother's house along with his parents. They live in Tinguiña in a brick, one-storey house. He has a moto-taxi, which he acquired with a loan from Crediscotia. He began with this job as a driver. Currently, he has his own vehicle. Luis has many dreams and goals. One of them is to have more vehicles. He will use the money he is requesting for general maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is 52 years old and married, with four children. Her children are excelling in their school and jobs. Her husband is a businessman and also supports the home. She sells planks at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is very hard-working and is looking forward to making use of this loan effectively. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the village of Burgos. She is 29 years old. Marites is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marites E..

Marites is married. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
47-year-old Agnatha lives in Benin City. She is married and has 5 children. Her children are between the ages of 13 and 23 years. She sells tailoring materials to customers at retail prices and has been in the trade for some years. She assists her husband in responding to some family needs like food, buying the children’s schoolbooks, clothing, etc. 

Her last Kiva loan was used to boost her business and she is happy about the improvement her business has experienced. Agnatha hopes to expand her business; she is requesting for loan amount of NGN 150, 000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She hopes to repay back her loan at the due date. She expresses her huge gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of San Carlos, Valencia City. She is 30 years old. Elsa is married. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 55 años, es un hombre honesto y trabajador, está casado con Alberta de 54 años, juntos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia, hecho de  material rústico. Desde hace más de 25 años, que se dedica al cuidado de frutas cítricas, plátanos y paltas, adicionalmente tiene un negocio de acopio de frutas oriundas de la selva peruana.  En la etapa de cosecha, cuenta con la ayuda de su amada esposa y la de su hijo mayor, consiguiendo así poder brindarle una vida cómoda a su familia. Dentro de su oficio de comerciante, le gusta atender a sus clientes, sin embargo le desagrada cargar los pesados cajones que lleva al mercado para venderlos. Para su futuro, desea comprar más hectáreas de terrenos que le permitan plantar café en mayor cantidad, de esa manera sus hijos puedan cosecharlo y con ello puedan beneficiarse. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y confía que sus cosechas serán exitosas como hasta ahora, por eso está contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal, por ser todos muy unidos. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, arrendará un terreno amplio, en donde plantará frutas cítricas, además piensa comprar docenas de sacos de fertilizantes e insecticidas parta evitar que las plagas consuman sus frutos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55. He is an honest and hardworking man who is married to Alberta, 54. Together they have 3 children, of whom only one still lives with them in their own house: a house constructed of rustic materials. For more than 25 years, he has worked with citrus fruit, bananas and avocados. On top of that he has a business of supplying native fruit from the Peruvian jungle. In harvest times, he has the help of his dear wife and of his oldest son. This way he can give a comfortable life to his family. In his business when he is selling, he likes to take care of his customers. Nevertheless, he doesn’t like to carry the heavy crates that he takes to market to sell the fruit. In the future we would like to buy more hectares of land that would allow him to plant a large quantity of coffee. In this way his children can harvest the coffee and they can get earnings from the crop. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he tells us that his crops will be as successful as they are now. He is happy to work with the communal group since the members are all united. With the three thousand new sols that he is requesting, he will lease a bigger field where he will plant citrus fruit. Besides that he wants to buy dozens of sacks of fertilizer and insecticides to avoid the infestations that eat his fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a field and buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and married with 4 children, aged between 4 months and 17 years. She is a farmer from western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. Grace has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years, and so far she has two employees. Her main produce is maize and beans. She also has some chicken broilers and layers (mainly kept for eggs) that she is able to sell to the locals. She also earns some income from the bricks that she makes and sells to the local market.

Grace has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to expand her poultry project. She believes that this is a great investment and hopes to get enough revenue supplementing her other income to be able to meet her family's needs. Her biggest challenge in running this business is the high cost of poultry feed and the changes in weather that affect the chicks. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by increasing the number of chickens and also diversifying into exotic breeds as well.

This being her first loan, she is optimistic that it will have a positive impact on her economically.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ROSA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA ZONA DE EL PASO, ELLA  VIVE EN CASA ALQUILADA MAS DE 8 AÑOS, SU SUEÑO ES COMPRARSE VIVIENDA LA VIVIENDA DONDE ESTA VIVIENDO. LA SEÑORA EMPEZO DESDE AYUDANTE DE COCINA EN UNA PENSION, TRABAJO DURO PERO DECIDIO INDEPENDISARSE Y BUSCO UN LUGAR ESTRATEGICO PARA PODER VENDER COMIDA, YA QUE ELLA AHORRO MUCHO PARA PODER ABRIR SU PROPIA PENSION AUNQUE SEA PEQUEÑA, COMO SE VE EN LAS FOTOGRAFIAS, ELLA LLEGO A LA INSTITUCION GRACIAS A OTRA CLIENTA, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MESAS Y SILLAS PARA LA MISMA. EL PUESTO SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PARTE NORTE DE COLCAPIRHUA A 3 KILOMETROS DE LA AVENIDA BLANCO GALINDO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rosa sells food in the El Paso zone. She has lived in a rented house for more than 8 years. Her dream is to purchase the house where she is living. She began as a kitchen helper at a guesthouse. She worked hard but decided to become independent and look for a strategic place to be able to sell food. She saved a lot to be able to open her small guesthouse, although it is small. As you see in the photographs, she arrived at the institution thanks to another client. The purpose of this loan is to be able to purchase more tables and chairs. The place is located in the northern part of Colcapirhua, 3 kilometers from Avenida Blanco Galindo. She is very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in providing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs

loans.name: Placida

texts.en: Placida G. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Placida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Placida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Placida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
La  Sra. Karla Solórzano P. es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en el mercado Israel lewite.
Ella junto con su marido administra el negocio, trabajan de lunes a domingo de las siete de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde vendiendo gaseosa, jugos, ropa y juguetes, ella se sube a los buses que se encuentran en la cotran del mercado cerca de donde tiene su tramo.
Ella a trabajado con ceprodel tres prestamos los cuales han sido para la compra de mercadería y asi poder ofertar mas productos y hacerle frente a la competencia que se encuentra al lado.
Karla dijo que se siente satisfecha con los prestamos que ceprodel le ha dado los cuales me han ayudado mucho en mi negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Solórzano P. is an enterprising person who has her business in the Israel Lewite market. She runs it together with her husband; they are open from Monday through Sunday from 7am until 6pm selling soft-drinks, juices, clothing and toys. She gets into the buses that stop at the market’s Cotran (bus station) near her stall to sell her products. She has been collaborating with Ceprodel for three loans that she’s used to buy merchandise in order to have more varied stock to offer and be able to compete against competitors nearby. Karla said that she’s satisfied with Ceprodel’s loans which have been very helpful for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, purified water, Shaler Kola, clothing, purses, knapsacks, juices, toys.

loans.name: Emile

texts.en:
Emile is a 43-year-old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and their four children.

Emile owns a restaurant in his town where he serves all type of sandwiches like chicken, meat and more. He is well-known in his region for his tasty and delicious food.

Today, for the first time, Emile is requesting a loan to purchase tools and merchandise for his restaurant. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He says he is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is very welcoming.

Emile hopes to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools and merchandise for his restaurant

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. She is a hog-grower and corn farmer. She has been doing these activities for more than a few years now. It is also how her family earns their income. Her husband does the major farming duties while she helps sell their harvest and raises the hogs. She hopes to have a successful business someday.

Melanie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Melanie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride N.  is a 55 year old woman who breeds cattle in the small village of Saatli. She is married and has three children. Feride applied for 1000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and sheep. Her primary customers are local butchers. Once a month her husband takes animals for sale to the livestock bazaar. Feride wishes to improve her life conditions and to increase her income with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase four sheep and one cow.

loans.name: Yuk

texts.en: Yuk R., 32, is married with two young children living at home in Kampong Chnang province. She purchases and sells fish at the local market, typically making US$ 5 each day, and her husband raises pigs, typically making about US$ 2 each day as a pig farmer. Yuk R. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more pigs to breed and more fish to sell.

loans.use: pigs to raise and fish to sell

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan S. is from the village of Namnama. She is 43 years old. Susan is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Susan S..

Susan is married and has three school-aged children. Susan owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling flowers in the market. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kyanzaire Hiv/aids Tweyambe, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
K. Zaida, aged 46, is married with a family of four children and has been operating a retail shop from Kashenshero trading centre, Bushenyi for over 6 years. Here she trades in a variety of products, commonly household items like sugar, salt, soft drinks (sodas), water, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. She does this business alongside her other farming practices that include growing a variety of food crops like bananas and poultry keeping. 

Her main drawback is that she has a limited variety of products in her shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. Therefore she is looking forward to increasing the stock in her business when she gets a loan and can expand fully. This will help her earn more revenue and sustain her daily needs and further educate her children. 

She belongs to Kyanzaire, a group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase more stock for the business

loans.name: Orquideas San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Orquídeas de San José, tiene este nombre porque a la presidenta del grupo le gustan mucho las orquídeas y ella les comentó a las integrantes del grupo.  El grupo estuvo de acuerdo y por ese motivo se llama así. Se ubica en Tula de Allende Hidalgo, México, el grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.
La Sra. Verónica M. Mejía es la presidenta del grupo tiene 28 años de edad estudió hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y venta de estas, inició su negocio hace aproximadamente 3 años, solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y que de esta manera crezca para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y su familia en general. 
La Sra. Rosa Matilde Rodríguez T. es otra integrante de este grupo tiene 39 años de edad estudió hasta la secundaria, su estado civil es unión libre tiene 2 hijos uno de 15 años y otro de 10 años de edad, el mayor es hombre y la menor es mujer. La Sra. Rosa Matilde se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, negocio que inicio hace aproximadamente 5 años, solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que espera hacerlo crecer y de esta manera poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que son la razón por la que ella se esmera tanto en salir adelante echándole todas las ganas del mundo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Orquídeas de San José” (St. Joseph’s Orchids) so called because the group President likes orchids very much and she mentioned this to the group members.  They agreed and that’s why it’s called that.  It is located in Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, México.  It has 12 members.

Mrs. Verónica M. Mejía, 28, is group President.  She finished middle school and she makes and sells crafts.  She started her business about three years ago and is asking for funds to invest in her business so that it will grow and to provide a better quality of life for her daughter and her family in general.

Mrs. Rosa Matilde Rodríguez T. is another member of the group.  She is 39 years old and finished middle school.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 15 and 10 years of age.  The oldest is a boy and the youngest is a girl. 

Rosa Matilde sells fruits and vegetables, a business she started about 5 years ago.  She is asking for funds to invest in the business hoping it will grow so that she will be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.  They are the reason she tries so hard to get ahead making the best possible effort in the world.

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida M. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She is 35 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide food for her family and at the same time pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chhum Sen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum S. is the village bank president who has been selected by seventeen members, located in Kouk Pring village in Kandal province, who make up a village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families' standard of living  She was born in 1962 and is a farmer who owns a small piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Ra Yorng, is a commune chief who receives only a low salary to support his family. She is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

At present, Mrs. Chhum S. is not comfortable living in her house because her yard is always invaded by some animals who damage her plants near her house. So, to improve her house, Mrs. Chhum S. is requesting a loan to buy metal netting and other supplies to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To buy metal netting and other supplies to build a fence to surround her house

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo A. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 58 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling Christmas lanterns and other home decor like wall frames in the local community. Danilo is just starting this business.

In 2010, Danilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials needed for the christmas lanterns & working capital. This loan will be Danilp's 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for the Christmas lanterns & working capital

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia, de 49 años, vive al lado de su esposo Víctor de 50 años, de su hijo que es mayor y estudia; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica, desde hace 6 años, a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. Realiza su labor durante todos los días y ofrece la mercadería mediante el catálogo con el cual sus clientes le realizan pedidos, y como es conocida ya tiene clientes fijos que le piden con frecuencia. Además en su casa ha logrado adaptar un espacio donde ofrece a sus amigas productos de belleza que tiene en stock, de esta manera obtiene buenas ganancias. Le gusta mucho su labor porque es tranquila, y como pasa  buena cantidad de pedidos al mes, con frecuencia recibe incentivos de la compañía para la que trabaja. Y tiene muchos planes para el futuro como instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa o en el mercado de su zona, pues el espacio de su casa le esta quedando un poco pequeño. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar progresando en su negocio. Dionicia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, pues quiere ofrecer una buena cantidad de variada mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionicia is 49 years old and lives with her husband, 50 year old Victor, and her adult son who attends school.  They all work together every day to get ahead.  This entrepreneurial woman has been selling a well-known brand of beauty products for the past six years.  She works every day and offers her products through a catalog, through which her customers place their orders with her.  Since she is well known, she has steady customers who order from her often.

She has set aside an area in her home, where she offers the beauty products, that she keeps in stock, to her friends.  In this way she is able to make a good income.

She enjoys her work very much because it’s easy and she gets a good amount of orders each month and often gets incentives from her company.  She has many plans for the future, such as installing a small shop in her home or in the zone marketplace because the area she has set aside in her home is a bit small.

This will be her third loan through MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time because she does not want to be in a bad light with the people who provided the money to make it possible for her to continue advancing her business.

Dionicia will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products in quantity.  She wants to offer a larger variety to her customers.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a single young man who is very industrious and hardworking. He is a dairy farmer, rearing dairy cattle for milk. He sells the milk to the residents of Kangemi. This is his primary business, in which he has been engaged for the last three years.

Aside from dairy farming, James is also an electrician by training and profession. He carries out repairs for the residents of the Kangemi trading center. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is already a member of KADET.

This is the first loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to use it to buy animal feed for his dairy cow. He will also invest in his electrical business by buying tools and other materials required for his job.

If the loan improves the business, he intends to open up an electrical shop to sell electrical gadgets and also to expand his farming.

loans.use: To buy animal feed to supply his dairy business and tools required for his job as an electrician.

loans.name: José Clemente

texts.es:
El señor José Clemente G. esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar material para su negocio ya que se dedica a la elaboración de protecciones y puertas  metálicas. 
Esta solicitando su cooperación para poder comprar el material y  así poder entregar a tiempo los pedidos de las protecciones y que sus clientes este satisfecho con el trabajo y la puntualidad de la entrega. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y tiene tres hijos que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
Jose Clemente G. requests a loan to purchase materials he needs for his business. He makes security grids and metallic doors. 

He requests your help to purchase the material in order to be able to deliver the products to his clients on time. He wants his clients to be satisfied with the work and with the delivery time. 

He plans on repaying the loan with a portion of his earnings from his business. This business is the only source of income for the family. He has three children who are in school.

loans.use: To purchase working material for his shop.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a 39-year-old married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Tom has been buying and selling produce for the last 13 years. He started his business in his village with capital of 500,000 UGX, but when the business expanded, he shifted it to town. His biggest business challenge is fluctuation in coffee prices. His vision is to expand his business, set up a business for his wife, build another residential house and educate his children. Tom is requesting a loan to purchase coffee for resale.

loans.use: To purchase coffee for resale

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
Junita L. is from the village of Mambatangan, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Junita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Junita sells rice and dried fish in the local community. Junita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Junita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business.

Junita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell, like rice & dried fish. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Junita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
