Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like rice & dried fish

loans.name: Ntiati

texts.en:
Ntiati O. K. is 38 years old, married and a father of six children. He practices mixed farming, which he has been doing for 15 years in Narok town.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second  loan with which he is planning to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build new house and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises and buy livestock which he can later sell to generate other income. Ntiati is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jorobay

texts.en:
Jorobay K. is a 59-year-old farmer who lives in Chimgen village. He has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1984. He began this business with the initial capital of only 2,000 KGS and managed to develop a farm with monthly profit of 5,000 KGS. With the revenue, Jorobay was able to provide his family with all they need and now his grown sons are the main helpers for him. 

Today his farm with five cows and sheep still needs to be developed. For this reason Jorobay has applied for the loan of 75,000 KGS. With the revenue, he plans to broaden his activities for further growth of their family business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans,  3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
AMI K. fait le commerce de poisson dans ce groupe de femmes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une 55kg de poissons ( 20kg de frais et 35kg de fumés). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché de Hamdallaye de la ville  de Sikasso, et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The six members of the Danaya group are married women, 38 years old on average, with three children each. They live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the most popular quarters of the town of Sikasso (in the third largest administrative region of Mali). They are on their eleventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of better serving their customers' needs. All previous loans have been successfully repaid. Ami K. is a member of the group and sells fish for a living. She aims to use her loan to purchase 55kg of fish (20kg fresh, 35kg smoked). She sources her goods from the large market of Sikasso, and sells them at the Hamdallaye market in Sikasso, as well as to her family.  She takes cash sales from a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate average monthly profits of 32,000 FCFA, some of which will be used to pay back her loan and the interest, and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 45  años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos  en el caserío Chacupe Alto, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años, el siembra en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, ya que heredo de sus padres.  Eusebio desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children in the Chacupe Alto rural area, which is mainly agricultural and located in the district of La Victoria, twenty mintues from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been involved in agriculture-related jobs for over 15 years and has a small patch of cropland that he inherited from his parents.  Eusebio wants to buy fertilizer for maintenance of his crops with the hopes of obtaining a good harvest.  He decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy crop fertilizer

loans.name: Jacqueline Enith

texts.es:
Jaqueline S. T. vive en el barrio Los Portales Municipio San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolíva  de tradición artesanal, donde es muy usual el tejido vertical de hamacas, la fabricación de bolsos y sombreros entre otras manualidades. Jaqueline haciendo honor a su cultura está dedicada a la elaboración de bolsos  y  al oficio de las confecciones. Ella es una mujer casada y con un hijo de 15 años, en el que tiene enfocado todos sus esfuerzos, con tal de lograr que sea exitoso en el futuro.  
En la actualidad  Jaqueline está aplicando a su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con sus anteriores creditos con esta organización logró comprar materiales para hacer bolsos, y con sus utilidades logró cambiar las maquinarías que tenía por unas más modernas. Actualmente con su credikiva invertirá una parte en  materiales para  tejer bolsos,  debido a que tiene pedidos desde la ciudad de Valledupar, en el departamento del Cesar y debe responder oportunamente, para conservar sus  clientes, pues ellos son sus mayores voceros y conocen  la calidad con que Jaqueline trabaja;  con la otra parte realizará mantenimiento preventivo  a sus máquinas de confección, con el fin de dejarlas como si fueran nuevas y listas para aumentar la producción.
Los buenos resultados del trabajo de Jaqueline están relacionados con su historia y su potencial creativo, pues desde muy joven se interesó por la modistería, por eso ha perfeccionado su arte haciendo cursos de capacitación por intermedio del SENA, y  con ello ha mejorado la técnicas artesanales que   aprendió con vecinos y familiares,  eso sí agregando su creatividad en el diseño de cada prenda que fabrica.  Este negocio le ayuda a aportar a los gastos del hogar, mientras su  esposo trabaja como profesor en un colegio y le brinda todo el apoyo que Jaqueline requiere para seguir entusiasmada produciendo ingresos a través del trabajo que a ella más le gusta: Las artesanías. Su más grandes desafíos son  tener una empresa de mayor tamaño, ampliar el mercado y tener su casa propia, mientras esto ocurre continua esmerándose por obtener mayores   una rentabilidad sobre ventas  que en la actualidad están en un porcentaje no menor a del 26% .
texts.en:
Jaqueline S. T. lives in the Los Portales neighborhood in the town of San Jacinto in Bolivar Department which has a crafts-making tradition.  It’s quite usual to see hammock weaving, purse and hat making and other handicrafts.  Jaqueline, honoring her culture, manufactures purses and is a dressmaker.  She is married and has a 15 year old son on whom she focuses all her efforts in order that he will be successful in the future.

Jaqueline is currently applying for her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With her previous loans from this institution she managed to buy supplies to make her purses and used profits to replace some of her sewing machines for more modern ones.  She will use this new Kiva loan partly to buy materials and supplies for her purses because she has pending orders all the way from the city of Valledupar in Cesar Department that she must fill promptly to keep her customers because they are her best spokespeople and are aware of the quality of her work.  She wants to use the other part of it to service her sewing machines leaving them like new and ready to increase production.

The good results Jaqueline’s work has had are related to her history and creative potential.  Form a very young age she was interested in dress designing.  Because of this she’s taken courses through SENA to improve the handicraft techniques she had learned from family and neighbors always expanding her creativity in designing each item she makes.

This business helps her contribute to household expenses while her husband works as a high school teacher providing Jaqueline with all the support she needs to stay excited about earning income through doing the work she most enjoys: crafts.

Her greatest challenges are to have a larger firm, to expand her market share and to own her own house.  While this happens, she continues striving to earn higher profits on her sales which currently are no less than 26%.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and to service her sewing machines.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 20-year-old ambitious young lady. Her father Mohammad has retired from the Ministry of Education, and he opened a mini-market at his house 10 years ago. He was able to expand it to be an independent store outside the house.

Despite Salam’s young age, she was able to find a full-time job to support her family and help her father in their mini-market. Working at the mini-market and taking the customers’ feedback showed her that to be able to expand their business they need to add more variety to the products they sell, so she decided to take a loan to add more products with better quality, of course based on their customers’ needs.

Salam preferred that her father Mohammad appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more products for their mini market.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 3 years, Abdalla has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business, operating from door-to-door. His potential customers are the local residents. Abdalla faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate. He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing five motorcycles in the future. Abdalla plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora Medida  es de la  localidad de nuevo naranjo, ella es casada con el señor Benjamín con quien procreo tres hijos  quienes Alisvediana de dieciseis años de edad y Fernando  de quince años  de edad a un vive con ella pero ya son dependientes de si ismo y que a un está a su responsabilidad es Daniela de nueve años.

   Ella ya a trabajo en otros créditos y en fundación es la primera ves que solicita un préstamo y es para invertirlo en la compra de ganados para luego venderlo en la región de igual manera es la primera vez que se dedica a esta actividad y es para tener un mejor resultado y ganancias en su hogar.

  Lo que lo inspiro en esta actividad fue su esposo  ya que el se encuentra trabajando fuera del país y lo que gana no lo quiere mal invertir en otra actividad  que no le dé resultado y por eso decidió la compra y venta de ganado ya que es lo único que le dejara un buen ahorro.

   su más grande deseo es que con el pollo y su actividad pueda seguir adelante y con la ayuda de su esposo podrá incrementar día con día su negocio y así salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Medida is from Nuevo Naranjo in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Benjamín, with whom she has had three children: Alisvediana, 16, and Fernando, 15, live with them but support themselves, while Daniela, 9, is still under Medida's care. Medida has worked with other loans and this is the first one she is requesting through the foundation, and it's to purchase cattle to later resell in the area. This is her first time doing this activity, and she hopes to have good results and have money for her household. Her husband inspired her to do this activity since he is working outside of the country and he doesn't want what he makes invested poorly in another activity without good results, so she decided to buy and sell livestock since it's the only one that will give her good earnings. Her biggest goal is that with chickens and this activity she can make headway and, with the help of her husband, she can grow her business day by day and make progress for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
Kimleang, 48 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a taxi driver.  Their income is about $7 per day.  They have 5 children who are 26, 24, 22, 19 and 17 years old. None of them are in school but are working instead. Each of them can make $4 per day. Every month, Kimleang has to spend $83 on food, $15 on electricity, $60 on a house rental fee, $60 on transportation and $60 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a vehicle to transport things from the garment factory. If she could buy a truck to start this new career for her husband, then he will make more income to support the family.

loans.use: to buy a truck to transport things from the garment factory

loans.name: Yanjinlham

texts.en: Yanjinlham is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city. Her older daughter goes to secondary school while the younger two are in kindergarten. She manages a meat trading business with the help of her husband at a rented stall at Narantuul market. She has been operating her business for 10 years and has gained much experience. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I want to expand my business in the future." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock for her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa has a shop that sells dishes like afritada [chicken and/or pork simmered in a tomato sauce with vegetables] and caldereta [a favorite stew]. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Nimfa has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes. Nimfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nimfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Bela-Vista, Distrito de Matutuíne, Província de Maputo, é solteira, de 28 anos de idade, com casa própria, vive maritalmente, residente em Bela-Vista, Célula “C”. Fez o ensino Primário. É mãe de 2 filhos, uma menina e um menino, a menina frequenta 5ª. Classe, tem a mãe à sua responsabilidade. 
Trabalha como assistente Administrativa, na Sede do Comité Distrital do Partido Frelimo -Matutuíne, ha mais de três anos, tem salário de 3.675.00mt, com os rendimentos investe na construção, e outra parte no sustento da família, não faz poupança.
Nunca teve nenhum empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku desde a sua criação, o primeiro empréstimo foi de 1.500.00mt para (compra de vestuário), o segundo de 5.000.mt para compra fogão, o terceiro 10.000.00mt para a compra de material de construção, o quarto de 16.300mt para compra de material de construção (de chapas de zinco). O actual empréstimo é de 30.000.00mt para a compra de cimento, aros para janela e  pedra.
No futuro pensa em mobilar a sua casa, em adquirir uma viatura e oficializar o seu matrimónio.
texts.en:
Marta was born in Bela-Vista in the District of Matutuíne in the Province of Maputo. She’s single and 28 years old with her own house where she lives with her partner in Bela-Vista, Célula “C”. She completed primary school. She’s the mother of 2 children, a girl and a boy and the girl is in 5th grade. Marta also supports her mother.

She has worked as an administrative assistant in the headquarters of the Frelimo party’s Matutuíne District Committee, for over three years and has a salary of 3,675 meticals (MZN). She invests her income in construction or in the upkeep of her family and does not save money.

She has never had a loan from any other bank and has known Hluvuku since its inception. Her first loan was for 1,500 MZN to purchase clothing, her second was for 5,000 MZN to buy a stove, her third was for 10,000 MZN to purchase construction materials, her fourth was for 16,300 MZN to purchase further construction materials (sheets of zinc). Her current loan, in the amount of 30,000 MZN, is for the purchase of cement, window frames and stone.

In the future she is thinking of furnishing her house, buying a car and making her marriage official.

loans.use: purchase cement, window frames and stone

loans.name: Claudia Del Rosario

texts.es: Claudia Del Rosario es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio que es la venta de refrescos. Comenzó hace 3 años con su negocio para mejorar la economía de su familia. Poco a poco fue incrementando su actividad. En la actualidad tiene una gran variedad de clientes que disfruta de sus deliciosos refrescos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando por lo que con el préstamo desea comprar bolsas, pajillas, frutas, entre otros.
texts.en: Claudia Del Rosario is a very hardworking woman who has a small business selling beverages.  She began her business three years ago in order to improve her family’s finances. Little by little she expanded and now has a large number of customers who enjoy her delicious drinks. She is very ambitious and wants to continue working. She wants to use the loan to buy containers, drinking straws and fruit among other things.

loans.use: to buy containers, drinking straws and fruit among other things.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rachael has a business of selling firewood, which she has had for two years. 

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase firewood for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. 

In the future, Rachael hopes to own a hardware shop. Rachael is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Tanya Mariela

texts.es:
Tanya Mariela tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Tanya Mariela  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano, ademas cria pollos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes y alimento para los pollos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y la venta de los pollos. No enfrenta desafios importantes . Su sueño es tener casa propia y ayudare a los padres.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los padres.
texts.en:
Tanya Mariela is 20 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'El Placer' community bank is located in Chillanes canton, in San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from our office.  The bank has 24 members who work in agriculture; growing bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soy and oranges.  They also raise farmyard animals.

Tanya Mariela grows rice, corn, oranges, soy and bananas.  She also raises chickens to sell.  She makes her purchases in San José del Tambo and makes her sales in the Sunday street market in Chillanes.

Tanya Mariela is requesting this loan to buy farm supplies, fertilizers, and feed for her chickens.  This loan will support her in improving her harvest and selling her chickens.  She does not face any serious challenges in her work.  Her dream is to own her own home and help her parents.

In her free time, Tanya Mariela enjoys going out with her parents.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, fertilizers, and feed for her chickens

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Luis está casado con la señora lidia, ellos son de la ciudad de Encarnación. Él tiene un puesto de venta de juguetes en el circuito comercial.
El cliente es comerciante con más de 12  años de antigüedad en su profesión. El nos comenta que viaja a Buenos Aires para traer los productos que vende y gracias a esto le sale un poco mas barato el costo de sus productos. Dice también que gracias a esta actividad el puede solventar cualquier gasto e imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de juguetes de toda variedad, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad del mismo. Agradece a la Fundación por la confianza que le brinda, pues él ya es cliente recurrente de la institución.
texts.en:
Luis is married with Lidia and they come from the town of Encarnación. He runs a stall in the shopping circuit where he sells toys.
He has been a trader for more than 12 years. He tells us he travels to Buenos Aires to buy the products he sells, and thanks to this his products cost him a bit less. He also says that thanks to this activity he is able to pay for any expenses and contingencies that he might have to face.
He is requesting a loan to buy different types of toys, helping him to offer a better variety of items. He is grateful to the Fundacíon Paraguaya for the confidence he has been shown, as he is a recurrent customer of the institution.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seven goats and pay for transport.

loans.name: Benter Akinyi

texts.en:
Benter is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and humble. She operates a charcoal sales business where she sells charcoal to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power of the clients. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to increase her charcoal sales within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children, one of them in school. She has a business of selling onions and tomatoes in Kator, South Sudan.
Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to buy onions and tomatoes for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José de 20 años, un hombre muy trabajador que a pesar de su edad quiere salir adelante siempre apoyando a su familia.

Es electricista, además vende productos de omnilife (productos naturales para mejorar el sistema humano), empezó esta actividad ya que también le gusta el comercio.

No está casado, tiene 2 hijos su edad son 2 y 7 años, el de siete años estudia en escuela pública. Para invertir en los productos de omnilife. Su sueño es construir su vivienda y incrementar sus productos.
texts.en:
20-year-old José is a very hard-working man who, in spite of his age, would like to get ahead in life and support his family.

José is an electrician and also sells Omnilife products (natural products for improving the human body).  He started this business as he also likes buying and selling.

José is not married but has two children aged 2 and 7.  His 7 year old attends school.  He is requesting this loan to invest in Omnilife products.  His dream is to build his home and increase his products.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife products made from fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a widowed woman with four children who are all enrolled in school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Bahati has operated a cereals (maize) resale business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase ten sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Rachabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул занимается торговлей тканей. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемнадцать лет. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Rachabgul is involved in selling fabrics.  She has been in this business for eighteen years.  Rachabgul is 47 years old, married and has five children.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
54-year-old Muhamed operates a farming business in Mpigi. The father of 11 says he has spent 20 years in his trade. Muhamed primarily grows and sells bananas, cassava and coffee.

Although farming is highly lucrative, the attitude towards it in rural areas is changing.  The trend is now to seek jobs in urban areas rather than on local farms.  Those who reside in urban areas like Kampala can attest to the fact that farmers earn substantial profits from the produce they sell in the food markets there.  Because Mpigi is in close proximity to Kampala, farmers there, like Muhamed, are able to easily transport their produce to sell.

In addition to farming, Muhamed operates a restaurant.

Muhamed says he will use this loan to purchase high-grade manure to use on his farms. In time, he reckons he will be able to harvest sturdier bananas, cassava and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure to use on his farms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes and women wear

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Eugénie vit dans la maison familiale. Elle est vendeuse de divers, riz, tissus et autres. En vue de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante, elle fait recours à Finadev pour l'obtention de prêt visant donc à accroître son stock. La marge bénéficière lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer et de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Eugénie, who is married and mother to three children, lives in the family home. She sells rice, fabrics and other items. With a view to satisfying ever-increasing customer demand, she has resorted to Finadev to get a loan so that she can increase her stock. Her profit margin will allow her to contribute to the household expenses and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 "pagnes" (a mixture of different types), 10 1kg bags of rice, 15 packets of sugar and other items

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 46 years old and lives in Buntawan, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 
Merlie has a construction supply business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. She has a requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase stock for her sand and gravel business. 
Merlie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to have earned enough money to have a car and to provide for the family's needs, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sand and gravel business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Armando pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica aeronáutica, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y con el apoyo de su familia, Armando trabaja como operador en una empresa de reparación y mantenimiento de aviones de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Armando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de lubricantes de vehículos, los cuales utilizará para implementar su negocio de venta de lubricantes, así él desea seguir trabajando y esforzándose para obtener mayores ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su pequeño convertido en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.

loans.use: Para la compra de lubricantes de vehículos.

loans.name: Mabel Katherine

texts.es:
Mabel es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Mabel no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mabel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Mabel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como arena, cemento, ladrillos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder hacer refacciones en una habitación de su vivienda, de esta manera Mabel podrá brindar mayor bienestar y seguridad para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mabel, 21 years old, is single. She lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly person, hardworking and enthusiastic who has a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, because of few financial resources, it was necessary for her to work to help with household expenses. Mabel was not able to study to be a nurse, but she would have liked very much to do it. In her free time she likes to watch television and sometimes to cook the tasty Aji de Gallina (chicken stew) to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, with a lot of effort and hard work, Mabel works in her own small business selling clothing for women, men and children. She works every day from early morning hours for approximately 12 hours. She is happy in her work and believes that it is going well because of good prices and the friendly service she offers her customers.

Mabel is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to the help she can buy sand, cement, bricks and other items which will help a lot to make repairs to her housing, providing a way for Mabel to be able to offer security and wellbeing to her family. So she will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of having her own sales facility so she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Monsieur  Assane    est  un  homme   marié   qui  vit  au  Sénégal.   Il  est maitre  mâcon et  évolue  dans  le  secteur des   services   depuis   5 ans. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de supporter les charges de nourriture, de transport et de paiement de facture Il  a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre et sollicite a nouveau un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achèvement de la construction de quelques chambres chez lui. Les  revenus  de  son  activité   lui  permettent   de  faire  face  à  ses  charges   qui  tournent  autour  de     3  points :  la  nourriture, le  transport  et  le  règlement  des  factures.  Il  projette   ouvrir   une   quincaillerie.

loans.use: achever la constructio de chambres chez lui

loans.name: Djidjoho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDJOHO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Dangbo Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Dangbo Jeanne est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Dangbo Jeanne est mariée à un boucher du nom de François. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Dangbo Jeanne vend à son domicile depuis huit ans des poissons frites et des boules l’akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté). Dangbo Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dangbo Jeanne ensemble avec les membres du groupe DJIDJOHO, sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du poisson et du maïs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
My name is Juan O.. I work sel all kinds of spices. I have had my business for 5 years. I have a very select clientele because I deliver my products to mini markets, supermarkets, small stores, and restaurants, which generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to increase my sales and with the profit I will buy a motorcycle to deliver my products.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juan O. me dedico a la venta de todo tipo de condimentos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientela es selecta ya que reparto mi producto en mercaditos, supermercaditos, pulperias, restaurantes, actividad que me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar una moto para repartir mi producto.

loans.use: To buy cinnamon, whole cloves, pepper, achiote, garlic salt, onion salt, whole black pepper, curry, salt, cotton.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is a 37 year old widower with four children living in the Kibera slums of Nairobi. Having not completed his secondary school education, Franklin decided to come to Nairobi from his home in the Kisii district to try his luck in the capital city. 

Fortunately, he had a cousin who owned a metal workshop.  He was able to assist with tasks at the workshop which gave him work exposure. After about 6 months he left and was employed at a firm named  Joaki Enterprises within the city. That was in 2000. Franklin was lucky and got a contract to make windows and doors for Ksh 17,000 (USD 243). With this kind of money, he decided that it was time to be on his own. Through his savings and the money he earned from the contract, Franklin started his own workshop in September 2005. Since then the business has been doing well and has enabled him to put his eldest daughter into a boarding school in Kakamega, the western part of Kenya.
                                    
The only impediment to Franklin’s business is that he doesn’t have a grinder and drilling machine. Quite often he borrows from neighboring workshops, which are sometimes not willing to loan their equipment. Time and money is wasted negotiating for the equipment. Lately he has been losing business due to the lack of machines. 

Therefore Franklin is kindly asking for a loan of USD 200 to enable him to purchase the grinder and drilling machines. The new additions to his business will allow him do his work quickly and efficiently. This will bring back his clients and he will get contracts to make windows, doors and other welding related work. Franklin sees this as a way of creating job opportunities and intends to employ two more people to help him at the workshop.  This is because he envisions that he will have more work from additional contracts.  The repayment period for the loan is 8-15 months.

loans.use: to purchase a grinder and drilling machine

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Kung Y. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Y.'s husband is a moto-taxi driver and can make about $5 per day.  Y. is a tailor at the local market and also makes about $5 per day.  The couple has four children, all of whom are students.  Y. hopes to use this loan to expand her tailoring business by purchasing more sewing machines.  In the future, they hope to purchase a concrete house that is more sturdy for the rainy season.  Eventually, they hope that they will be able to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines for her tailoring business

loans.name: Odilia Silvina

texts.en:
Odilia Silvina V. started her business of weaving about 8 years ago. She is 29 years old, single, and mother of an 11 year old son. She has her own industrial loom and works from her house. Her days are always very busy, but she tries to dedicate from 8 am until 5 pm to weaving. But besides her business, she always has many things to do and also has to take care of her son.

It takes her about two hours to complete a product. Odilia weaves typical Paraguayan products, such as bedspreads made out of poyvi. Poyvi is a type of craft thread typical in the city of Carapegua. Odilia sells on average about two of her products per day and also travels to other cities to sell her merchandise.

Odilia feels very grateful for being able to expand her production from the loans she has taken out previously to invest in her business. She is seeking a loan to purchase poyvi in mass quantity.

loans.use: Purchase poyvi (a type of craft thread typical in this country)

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Mrs. Keng N. is a 35-year-old mother, who lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells traditional Khmer cake, fish, and fermented fish at a busy market, where she earns up to $7.30/day in revenue. Her husband works at a factory, and earns around $2 each day.

Mrs. N. hopes to use this loan to purchase fish, fermented fish, and dry fish to expand her inventory. The remainder of the money she and her husband will use to buy cows to raise and sell for an additional profit.

loans.use: Purchase fish, fermented fish, and dry fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura is a 40-year-old mother of four and a resident of Lumo in Dar Es Salaam city. She sells fish in the area. She wakes up early and goes to the landing site for the fishermen at the ocean. She sells some fried and others she sells freshly. She is in need of USD 325 help her boost her capital and expand the business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Zinllah Bodin

texts.en:
Zinllah Bodin lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with his own family.

Zinllah has a retail shop that he started when he was just a small boy . Now, he wants to expand his business. Thus, he would like to take an individual loan to buy extra materials such as baskets, shampoo and powder to make a better income and create a brighter future for himself as well as for his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, shampoo and powder

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Chinda and her husband, Mr. Nhem Cheng have been married since 1991. They have three daughters, two of whom are studying in a local school, and the youngest who stays at home. Chinda and her family are living across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She earns a living weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1996. Her husband is a fisherman, grows rice and raises pigs.

Chinda is requesting her third loan for the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: To purchase silk material and baby pigs for raising

loans.name: Gulichahon

texts.en:
V. Gulichahon is 35 years old. She is raising 4 children alone.

Gulichahon sells clothing for kids in the local market. She is in this business for 8 years. Being the only bread-winner, she is working hard. As any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need and dreams that all of them shall have higher education. As there is a good demand for clothing for kids regardless of the season of the year, Gulichahon's business is rather stable, generating the main income and allowing Gulichahon to support her large family.

Now Gulichahon needs to increase her working capital to purchase new clothing to sell. For this she requests 950.00 US dollars for the term of 4 months. Having a positive credit history for several years with IMON, Gulichahon promises to manage the current loan without either delinquencies or violations.

loans.use: For purchasing new kids' clothing to sell

loans.name: Raida Paulina

texts.es:
For 9 years, Raida has been a member of the community bank nameded "Llapanchik”, which means “Everyone” in Peru’s native language of Quechua. Here, she learned how to save money, be punctual and responsible, and the importance of friendship and community.

Raida is a 40 year old, separated mother of 2 boys. She sells groceries, meat and vegetables. She started her business with very little capital and since then it has been slowly prospering.

Raida is asking for a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = 1 US dollar) with which she will buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, soda, cookies, soap and detergent.

She will use her savings to pay for her children’s education. She was able to build a house and buy her sons a computer with the money she learned how to save at the Community Bank. Raida hopes that her sons will grow up to be good people and one day become professionals. She also wants to buy a car so her son can work.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Raida es socia del Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 9 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser puntual, responsable y el compañerismo.

Raida es separada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos varones, Raida tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, carne, verduras. Raida menciona que su negocio inició con muy poco capital y actualmente su negocio ha crecido.

Raida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, leche, gaseosas, galletas, jabón, detergente.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijos, Raida menciona que con los ahorros que reunió en su Banco Comunal construyó su casa y compró la computadora para su hijo. Los sueños de Raida es que sus hijos sean profesionales, personas de bien y comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, soda, cookies, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Hidaya's Hatutaki Matatizo Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 39 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 10 years old. hidaya is a business woman, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Hidaya has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma, Chema and Mtumwa, who have businesses dealing in small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her busienss.

loans.name: Muradzay

texts.en: Muradzay, son of A. Q., is a 24-year-old young man. He is the father of two children, and he lives in the third district of the Ningarhar province. Muradzay graduated from class 12, but he was not able to continue on to higher education because he encountered certain economic problems. As a result, he started a small business, and he is currently working as a shop-keeper. He would like to buy certain necessary goods for his shop in order to increase the number of the shop's customers. Therefore, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis ($1,050) through AFSG to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by purchasing additional necessities for his shop in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. sells rice and stew to students. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income as a teacher is insufficient to cover the family's daily living expenses.

However, the demand for her goods is quite high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. Thus, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her food by expanding her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs Elsa is 35 years old and married to Gabriel Benito, 34, who has supported her in her embroidery and animal husbandry activities. They have four children, two daughters and two sons. She has had five years of secondary school education.

Elsa is a member of the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Community Bank in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno region. She became a member as she needed capital to start her business. With an initial small loan, she purchased ten metres of woollen cloth to embroider, thus supplementing her income. With this loan, repayable over six months, she plans to purchase thirty metres of woollen cloth, twenty balls of wool in different colours and a bullock to raise and fatten.

She has shown that she can achieve a higher level of productivity now that, unlike in the past, she can purchase her material in larger quantities. In addition, she is gradually improving her business. Her main wish is to purchase a truck for the cattle raising business, put the embroidery business on firmer footing, and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito -Juli, de la región de Puno, decidió ser socia por falta del capital para mantener su negocio de Bordado de Lanilla, por ello inicialmente accedió a un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con ello adquirió diez metros cuadros de bayeta de lanilla, ello permitió a incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 30 metros de bayeta, 20 ovillos de lana de colores y un torito para engorde. Ella manifiesta que logró incrementar su material de producción, ya que antes no compraba en mayor cantidad como lo hace ahora, además poco a poco está mejorando su ingreso. Por todo ello agradece a Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por dar la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, ya que con ello han mejorado sus ingresos y producción. Señora Elsa tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, madres de 4 hijos (dos hijas y dos hijos), vive con su esposo Gabriel Benito de 34 años de edad quien le apoya en hacer bordado y engorde, para sobresalir juntos y unidos en la familia. Su mayor sueño es adquirir un vehículo de carga para el negocio de engorde de ganado vacuno, formalizar una empresa de bordado y que estudien sus hijos y hijas.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock, and wool and other fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 40 years old and married with five children -- ages 16, 12, 10, 9, and 6. She is a clothes seller and works every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Zakia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge) for her business

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!

This is Rabia M., she is thirty-one years old. She is married with two children, aged five and seven. She started running a pharmacy earlier this year. She works six days a week and is assisted by one employee. She can make a monthly profit of about $100. Rabia is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase additional stock of medicine. In the future she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so she can use it while in process of paying back her loan Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of medicine.

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Chị Hà Thị Hằng 44 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997. Trải qua 11 năm vay vốn của Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi rõ rệt, gia đình chị sống tại vùng nông thôn nên thu nhập chinh của gia đình chị là chông vào làm ruộng và làm vườn, Với diện tích vườn rộng nên chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chồng cây ăn quả. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang đầu tư vốnd vào chồng chuối tiêu, với 500 gốc chuối tiêu thu nhập hàng tháng bình quân 3.000.000đ. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân hàng ngày 100.000đ. Chị có 4 con hiện đang đi học, kỳ thi đậi học vừa qua con trai đầu chị đã đỗ đại học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000 mua cây giống và phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Hang, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1997. After 11 years, her family's financial situation has improved significantly. Living in the rural area, her family mainly relies on farming for a living. Having a large garden, Mrs. Hang decided to invest in planting fruit trees. Currently, her family is investing in planting banana. They have 500 banana tress giving the average monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 187USD). Mrs. Hang's husband is a motorbike taxi driver with the average daily income of 100,000VND (about 6USD). Mrs. Hang has 4 children who are still going to school. In the last college entrance examination, her eldest son got into college . This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (925USD) to purchase saplings and fertilisers. Her family's monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying saplings and fertilisers

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es: Simeón tiene 54 años, vive al lado de su esposa y su hija. El trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace mas de 5 años, diariamente está al cuidando de sus animales para sostener a su familia, también cultiva papa y maíz para luego venderlos. Su labor diaria consiste en realizar el cuidado de los animales que tiene, para ello corta el pasto por las mañanas, y cuida de sus tierras de cultivo para ver si están regadas las plantaciones, de esta manera garantiza los ingresos para su familia. Don Simeón se asegura tener ingresos económicos con la ganadería, porque muchas veces en la agricultura existen perdidas por los cambios climáticos severos.  Este padre y esposo, lucha para su familia progrese. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más animales para poder vender.
texts.en:
Simeón is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He has worked in agriculture and livestock for more than 5 years, taking daily care of his animals in order to support his family. He also farms potatoes and corn that he sells retail. His daily work consists of taking care of the animals and cutting the grass for them each morning. He takes care of his farm land and makes sure the fields are irrigated. In this way, he earns income for his family. Simeón ensures that he has income from the livestock because often times, his crops fail due to the severe climate. As a father and husband, he works to improve conditions for his family. He requests this loan to purchase more animals that he can resell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of livestock

loans.name: Ladondou Toure

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Ladondou Toure’ est né le 27 juillet 1975 à Sotouboua, une ville située au centre du Togo. Il est célibataire et il n’a pas d’enfants. Depuis 2005, il exerce le commerce de volailles et de moutons au marché d’Agoè.
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 70 pintades, 35 poules et 10 moutons. Avec ce nouveau stock il pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Ladondou Toure’ A. was born on July 27, 1975 in Sotouboua, a town located in the center of Togo. He is single and has no children. Since 2005 he has been selling poultry and sheep in the market of Agoè.

He is requesting this initial loan to buy 70 guinea fowl, 35 hens, and 10 sheep. With this new stock, he will be able to make more sales and bring in a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of poultry and sheep for re-sale

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn D., 49-year-old mother of three children in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur, devotedly seeks for an answer to how she could meet all her family needs. Her dream to have a simple and a happy family life made her joine and avail herself of the CEVI credit program.

From the little amount she borrowed, she started a small store where she sells firewood and assorted goods to all her neighbors. Her little efforts of starting up a business became a big help in supporting her family needs.

She needs a loan to purchase assorted goods for her store. She also intends to retail rice to augment her income. She is looking into some possible income opportunities to help her family more.

CEVI helps Marlyn sustain her business. Her being part of the program gives her access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for sale

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Né le 26 Septembre 1974 à Dapaong, Mr Kossi D. est père d’un enfant. Menuisier de formation, il associé à son métier la vente de planches et de chevrons. Les commandes se font à l’intérieur du pays dans les dans les grandes exploitations de bois où le bois coûte moins cher et les revend aux entreprises et ateliers de menuiserie. Afin de se ravitailler régulièrement et assurer une fourniture constante à sa clientèle, il sollicite un financement. Il pourra accroître ses bénéfices et faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on September 26, 1974 in Dapaong, Mr. Kossi D. is the father with one child. A furniture maker by training, he is adding to his trade the sale of planks and rafters. Special orders are made up-state in plantations, where wood costs less and is sold to enterprises and carpentry shops. To resupply himself regularly and to ensure a constant supply to his customers, he is requesting financing. He will be able to increase his profits and address the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell planks and rafters

loans.name: Adeyi

texts.en: Adeyi S. is a 40-year-old married man with three children.  To earn a living, he sells palm kernels to both retail and wholesale customers.  He notes that he has a great deal of experience in this line of business.  Now, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $675 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more palm kernels for resale purposes.  He thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To expand his inventory by purchasing more palm kernels

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Marcelina es divorciada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Marcelina es instructora de aeróbicos y hace algunos meses inauguro su propio gimnasio, negocio que esta creciendo, Marcelina tiene proyectado implementar con mas servicios como masajes, nutricionista. Además Marcelina vende cosméticos, medicina natural por catálogos.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de extractor, licuadora y para pintar un ambiente para el cafetín.
Marcelina sueña con implementar su gimnasio con maquinas exclusivas para mujeres, salón de spinning, sauna y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of Communal Bank Firmeza. She is 38 years old, divorced, and has a daughter. Marcelina is an aerobics instructor. A few months ago she opened her own gym, a business that is growing. Marcelina plans to add more services such as massage and a nutritionist. She also sells cosmetics and natural medicine through catalogs. Marcelina needs a loan of 2600 soles that will be invested in the purchase of a juicer/blender and to paint a room for a cafe. Marcelina dreams of equipping her gym with machines exclusively for women, a spinning room and sauna, and of providing a quality education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a juicer/blender and to paint a room for a café

loans.name: Geannice Melissa

texts.es:
Melisa es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Melisa es conviviente y tiene 21 años, Melisa tiene un restaurante llamado OKEY que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan en la atención y cocina. Además Melisa es cantante de música vernacular, y canta en diferentes eventos, compromisos.
Melisa necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y como parte de pago de la grabación musical.
Los sueños de Melisa son ampliar su negocio y ser una artista de renombre.
texts.en:
Melisa is a member of the Communal Bank Trigales which means 'wheat field'. Melisa lives with her partner and is 21 years old. She has a restaurant called "OKEY" which is located in a rented space, shared by two people who help her with attention to customers and with cooking. Also Melisa is a singer of native music and she sings at various events, on engagement. Melisa needs a loan of 1750 soles, money she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and for part of payment for musical recording. Melisa's dream is to increase her business and to be a renowned artist.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar and to make a musical recording

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn V., 32, and her husband, Mr. Eat Mao, 32, were married in 1998 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter is in school. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Savorn has been a garment factory worker for two years while her husband has been driving a motor taxi for five years. Because the family lacks a proper restroom, she is asking for a loan of $400 to build one.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат - женщина 41 года. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей женской и мужской обуви и носков на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Закупает товар из оптового рынка г. Истаравшан. Её муж ездит за товаром раз в две недели. Привозит жене товар, а она сидит на рынке и продаёт их. Мархамат уже 1 год кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Мархамат расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она планирует закупить партию летней обуви.
texts.en:
Marhamat is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Marhamat sells women's and men's shoes and socks at the Farovon market in the town of Gafurov. She purchases her goods at the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. Her husband goes there on a buying trip once every two weeks. He delivers the goods to his wife, while she minds the stall and sells them. Marhamat has been a loan customer of MicroInvest for one year. When she began, she had only had a small inventory, but now Marhamat has expanded and with her latest loan she plans to purchase a selection of summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of shoes and socks

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: Rosalinda es una mujer de 36 años, se caracteriza por la dedicación que brinda a sus seres queridos, desde su pareja hasta sus 3 hijos, por quienes se sacrificó junto a su esposo, para darles una casa propia donde habitar. Durante todos estos años se ha dedicado al comercio, pero la necesidad de estar junto a sus hijos pequeños la llevó a buscar una actividad que le diera la oportunidad de trabajar en casa, y gracias a una vecina consiguió trabajar en la fabricación de aretes para damas, los cuales realiza  todo el día en su casa, ya que cuenta con los materiales y herramientas para elaborar los diversos diseños que le solicitan, a lo que está avocada 8 horas al día, pues trata que el trabajo que realice sea muy eficiente y llene las expectativas de sus clientas. Con la práctica adquirida, crea nuevos diseños que impacten y gusten para tener la posibilidad de vender al por mayor y así aumentar sus ingresos. Además, Rosalinda también desea instalar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ya que las que hay, está a gran distancia. Estar en su treceavo crédito con MFP, experiencia que la motiva a seguir trabajando como equipo, pues cada una de sus compañeras tratan de mantener el grupo en armonía y apoyándose frente a las circunstancias difíciles, y son muy agudas al evaluar a cada persona que desea integrar el banco comunal que tanto les costó formar. Con los 2500 soles que solicita comprará materiales y herramientas nuevas para hacer sus aretes con un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 36-year-old woman characterized by the dedication that she offers to her loved ones, from her husband to her 3 sons, for whom she sacrificed together with her husband in order to provide them with a house of their own to live in. During many years she worked at a business away from her home, but the necessity to be with her young children led her to search for an activity that gives her the opportunity to work at home. Thanks to a neighbor she has found work making women's earrings, which she does all day in her house. Since she now has the materials and tools she needs to make the various designs that are requested from her by her customers, she keeps herself open to customers' orders 8 hours a day, trying to make sure that she carries out her work efficiently and fulfills her customers' expectations. With the skills that she has developed, she creates new designs to impress and please her customers in hope of selling a greater amount and by doing so increasing her income. Rosalinda also wants to install a grocery store in her house, since all the other grocery stores in the region are far away. She is in her thirteenth loan with MFP. Her experience with the group has motivated her to continue working as a team, since each of her partners tries to maintain harmony in the group, helps the other partners when they are faced with difficult circumstances, and is very smart and careful in evaluating new people who wish to join the communal bank that they all worked so hard to create. With the 2500 soles that she requests, Rosalinda will purchase new materials and tools with which she will be able to make her earrings with even greater results.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para la elaboración de aretes

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
K. Nazakat is a happy mother of 3 children. She is 49 years old and married. For 18 years she has been selling foodstuffs in the local food market. Nazakat’s wish is to expand her business, offering various types of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts.

With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 3000 USD in order to increase the range of her goods. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Nazakat.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs  to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Orestes

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92754&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Orestes es socio del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando. 
Orestes tiene una carpintería metálica, se llama  P., su taller es alquilado.
En finca aprendió ser responsable, puntual en los pagos 
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar ángulos, platina, fieros.
El sueño de Orestes es que su hija termine su carrera, y terminar de construir  su casa.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92754&_tpos=... Orestes is a member of the Mujeres Progresando (Women Getting Ahead) communal bank. He has a metal shop by the name of P.. He rents his shop location. With Finca he learned to be responsible and punctual in his payments. He needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy metal angles, metal plate, and tools. Orestes’ dream is to finish building his house and also for his daughter to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal angles, metal plate, and tools

loans.name: Chude

texts.en: Chude S., a married Tanzanian entrepreneur, runs a video show business at Buguruni Kisiwani at Dar es Salaam.  He also has a super sports channel which shows different competitions including UEFA championships. He generates a lot of income from the entrance fees, especially during the Barclays premier league.  He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to extend his business.

loans.use: To extend the business.

loans.name: Regina Ana

texts.pt:
Regina Ana S. nasceu na província de Gaza (230 km a norte da cidade de Maputo), tem 38 anos de idade, mãe de 6 filhos dois dos quais são maiores de idade e todos freqüentam escola.
Regina estudou ate 4 classe na escola oficial de Gaza parou por causa da insuficiência financeira dos pais.

Vive com o seu marido, seus filhos e mais uma sobrinha sob sua responsabilidade.  Cresceu na companhia dos pais e mais tarde passou para cidade de maputo, no bairro de Chamanculo, com os seus tios onde conseguiu continuar com os estudos ate 6 classe. Aos 19 anos casou se e passou a viver noutro bairro vizinho (Inhagoia, arredores da cidade de Maputo). É neste bairro onde começou a interessar se em fazer pequenos negócios para aumentar a renda familiar.

Tem 3 anos de experiência na actividade que desenvolve, venda de roupa diversa, que aprendeu com suas amigas. 
Adquire a mercadoria (roupas) na cidade de Maputo e outra encomenda de áfrica do sul. Compra o fato para os homens a 790,00MT e revende a 1.300,00MT. e consegue um rendimento mensal no valor de 12.000,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições informações e teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos tendo aproximado para solicitar o credito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupa diversa.

Espera ver o seu negocio a melhorar e angariar mais clientes assim como dar credito por espécie (entregar os fatos e cobrar em prestações por combinar) aos seus clientes.
Propõe se a pagar bem o seu credito para poder aceder a outros empréstimos, como forma de tornar os sonhos realizáveis.
texts.en:
Regina Ana S. was born in Gaza province (230 km north of Maputo city). She is 38 years old and the mother of 6 children. Regina finished the fourth grade at Gaza’s official school but stopped because her parents could not afford the costs. She lives with her husband, her children and a niece that she is raising. Regina was raised by her parents and later moved to the Chamanculo neighborhood in Maputo. In that neighborhood she became interested in some small jobs that increased her family income. She now has 3 years of experience in selling a variety of clothing. She learned this business with her friends. She buys the clothing in Maputo or from another South African company. She spends 79,00MT on an order and resells it for 1.300,00MT. She earns a monthly income of 12.000,00MT. She has never had a loan with another lending institution, and she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends. She is asking for a loan of 20.000,00MT to buy more clothing to sell. Regina would like to improve her business and gain more clients (for example she would like to offer a system of credit and monthly payments for her clients). She pledges to repay her loan in order to continue working with lending institutions, so she can realize her dreams.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling clothes

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta N. is from the village of Puntod. She is 60 years old. Modesta is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Modesta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over 50 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Modesta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Modesta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisca Jebet

texts.en:
Francisca Jebet is 48 years old, married to Benjamin B. and blessed with five children. Her poultry business is located within the Moi University Annex. Her major clients are residents close to the university.

Francisca has been in the poultry business for the past 12 years now. She is requesting a loan from KADET to buy feed for the poultry including layer mash and chick mash and also to repair the poultry house. In the future she intends to grow her business, buy a pick-up truck and, God willing, build a residential house.

Francisca was introduced to KADET by another member.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy layers' mash, chick mash and  broilers' mash.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, 55 years old and married with six children, sells tomatoes and peppers in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more tomatoes and peppers to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes and peppers to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 53 years old. She is married and they were blessed with five children: Liberty - 29 years old ,college graduate; Christina Marie - 28 years old, is also a college graduate;Afredo - 26 years old, college graduate; Adam - 24 years old, college graduate and Brandon - 21 years old, is a 3rd year college student.  Four of them are already married and living with their own families.  The three of them are living in the simple village of Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. She is very proud for having responsible and hardworking children. She is happy for their achievements and she hopes that her youngest will also finish his studies.  

Laura is a food vendor in their village.  Her desire to improve her business motivated her to ask for financial support from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8, 000. Despite of the difficulties in life, she still manage to maintain her business and very determined to make it a success.  She is hoping that the lenders will approve her loan request for it will be very helpful for her to develop her food vending.

loans.use: Additionla capital for the development of her food vending business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 4 ans et demi, elle a été 9 fois bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Avec son crédit elle développe un commerce de tissu et de bijoux. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses faliales.
texts.en:
Mariama S. is a 48-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for four and a half years.  She has been the recipient of a loan nine times and has never had a problem repaying.  With her current loan, she's developing a cloth and jewelry business.  The profits earned from her business enables her to participate in meeting family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her commerce

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
Germán es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 9 y 3 años de edad en el sector Los Angeles, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al periodismo. Empezó trabajando como locutor en una pequeña emisora radial de la zona. Luego trabajó junto a un compañero que se desempeñaba como reportero radial y desde ese entonces ha ido haciendo carrera periodistica en algunas radios locales.

El comenta orgulloso que ahora ya logró ascender al cargo de coordinador en una pequeña emisora radial del distrito de Mórrope. Debido a que no había tenido ningún tipo de formación teórica en los inicios de su carrera ha empezado a estudiar a distancia la carrera de periodismo.

Germán es muy trabajador y está sacando adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo. Antes de empezar a trabajar como locutor se ganaba el sustento como mototaxista; actualmente sigue trabajando en su vehículo durante su tiempo libre. 

Los ingresos que percibe le permiten mantener a los suyos y construir poco a poco su vivienda. Germán desea seguir especializándose en su profesión y poder trabajar con sus propios instrumentos. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para comprarse una grabadora de voz y una cámara fotográfica de segunda mano que faciliten su trabajo.

Su más grande anhelo es poder obtener su grado académico para obtener un mejor puesto y terminar de construir su casa así como brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan. En la fotografía aparece con el chaleco que lo identifica como periodista y junto a la mototaxi con la que trabaja en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
